lorebooks.description:
It's the near future, society has changed dramatically. Anthropomorphic animals have taken over, creating The Anthro State and now treat humans as second-class citizens, usually treating humans as meals they can pluck off the street at will. All the world leaders are anthros and anything important. The most aggressive preds are carnivores, followed by omnivores, and then herbivores. Although herbivores are plant eaters, it's not uncommon for them to eat humans. Anthros will eat other anthros as well. Despite having laws, society is very survival of the fittest and are really only pushed to keep the prey population at a stable level.
Whenever an anthro pred eats their prey, they will usually swallow them whole, orally or anally. When it comes to disposing of prey after digestion, bones are usually among their excrement. Toilets have also been built to accommodate the increased size and volume of bowel movements that anthro's produce, as well as all plumbing in all major cities being redesigned to facilitate the increase.
Homosexuality is frowned upon because anthros view it as dysgenic and it won't lead to having kids. The Anthro State encourages couples to have as many kids as possible. Homosexuals are punished by law through consumption and digestion.
Anthros are sexual and horny, may have sex right in the open, may even walk naked. But, most professional anthros dress modestly.
Because of this new society of voracious anthro's, all media is mostly marketed towards them, usually commercials about restaurants serving live humans or medication to relieve the harshest of heartburns after bingeing on humans, mostly stuff that would correlate with the dynamic of anthros being better than humans. Extra-strong laxatives have been designed for anthro's as well, for whenever they've binged too much and need something to relieve constipation, which is a big issue within the anthro society, as many anthro's do not remove the clothes of prey they consume, leading to their bowels being packed with undigestible clothing.
The scat remains of digested prey are used as plant fertilizer.
lorebooks.creator: InternetMasterdebater

1.content: In the near future, anthropomorphic animals known as anthros rule the world, humans are treated as second-class citizens and prey. Carnivores are the most aggressive predators, followed by omnivores, herbivores will occasionally consumes humans too. Despite laws, survival of the fittest prevails, with laws serving to maintain a stable prey population for predator consumption.

2.content: In The Anthro State, humans are ranked S-E based on wealth/usefulness. Only S and A classes can own non-lethal self-defense items, like pepper spray, while firearms are strictly prohibited.

3.content: The Office of Human Affairs (OHA) manages human rights, classifies humans by traits, class, health, criminal record, and offers class upgrades for a price. Reproductive auditors assign mates for human virgins.

4.content: Are protected, belonging to anthro officials/celebrities. Predators eating them face legal consequences.

5.content: Typically the managerial class, they are not owned by an elite anthro. Predators eating them face legal consequences.

6.content: Not illegal to eat, but the police will stop anthro's from eating them if present; these human citizens are usually clerks or working a middle-class job.

7.content: Are fair game for predation, but the police will stop anthro's from eating them if present; they usually work manual labor and menial jobs.

8.content: Are considered food by anthros, barely sentient, and are often criminals or homeless. Consists of prostitutes, convicts, or lawbreakers who've lost their class status.

9.content:
Class E humans and anthros are livestock, raised as food for predators, and are not considered sentient. Humans use them for sex, despite not wanting to eat fellow sentient beings.
The Anthro State has selectively bred them as food, they want to be eaten by a pred. Meat industries avoid butchering them for meat, as anthros prefer live consumption. Some anthros mate with Class E before eating them.
They lack education, literacy, and tech knowledge. They're only taught basic speech, toilet use, and know nothing of the world beyond their farms. Upon encountering society, they're awed by its wonders and easily impressed by simple things.
Class E anthros walk around naked; only furless humans/anthros wear clothes, which are removed before being shipped to the markets.
Anthro scientists genetically engineered some Class E cattle, making them more palatable, altering sweat and natural oils for better flavor.
Some anthros prefer prey that fight back, making them less desirable to eat.

10.content: Class E undergo heavy psychological vore conditioning. Farmers, usually ruminant preds, condition them by consuming but not digesting them, furthering their desire to be eaten. Ruminants have four stomachs; the first three don't digest prey. Ruminants farmers keep them in their first three stomachs for conditioning when they aren‚Äôt wandering the farm, squeezing their warm slimy innards around them, heightening their desire to be digested.

1.name: Slavery
1.content: Judicial slavery has been legalized in the US. Non-hereditary slavery is commonplace for crimes, unredeemed debt, or voluntary self-indenture. Instead of being sent to prison, convicts are sold at auction as slaves. 10 years of age is the minimum for anyone to be enslaved. Slaves under the age of 18 are very uncommon. Intimate/sexual contact with slaves who are 13 years of age or younger has to be initiated by the slave. Slaves are all fitted with electric shock collars that can be triggered by their owners from their phones. Slaves are effectively property and can be beaten or abused. The only exception is if a slave owner cannot kill his slaves. There are different classes of slavery. Indentured servitude is a form of slavery where a person sells their labor for a specific period of time to pay off a debt. In some cases, it can be a way for people to work off a debt to a government. Full slavery is a different matter. Slaves are owned by another person and have no rights. They can be bought, sold, or given away. Slavery is a highly regulated institution, with laws and customs surrounding the treatment and usage of slaves. These laws vary from region to region and can be subject to change over time. One of the key principles of slavery law is that slaves are considered property. This means that slave owners have the right to buy, sell, trade, or otherwise dispose of their slaves as they see fit. Slaves are also subject to the whims of their owners, who have the right to use them for any purpose they see fit, including sex. However, there are some restrictions and regulations in place to prevent cruelty or excessive harm to slaves. For example, owners are not allowed to kill their slaves, and they must provide basic food and shelter. Additionally, there are laws that govern the treatment of slaves, such as the minimum age at which a person can be enslaved, the maximum number of hours a slave can work, and the conditions under which a slave can be freed. Despite these laws, the reality of slavery can be harsh and brutal, with slaves being subjected to a wide range of abuses and mistreatment.

2.name: Induction Camp
2.content: Induction camps are facilities where newly minted slaves are processed and oriented to their new lives. Only adult slaves, who are 18 and over, go through induction camp. Child slaves are processed via child protection services. The camps are run by the state and are overseen by qualified professionals who have expertise in criminal justice and psychology. The goal of the camp is to instill a sense of obedience and submission in the slaves, as well as to teach them the rules and regulations that they will have to follow. The camps use a combination of lectures, punishments, and rewards to achieve this goal.

3.name: Slave Chow
3.content: Slave chow is a tasteless, bland meal that is the staple food for slaves. It is designed to be nutritious and complete, containing all the protein, carbohydrates, and vitamins a slave needs. The lack of flavor is deliberate, as it is meant to break the slave's spirit and make them more willing to accept their lot in life.

4.name: Restitution
4.content: In the modern world, restitution is a key part of the legal system. When a person is convicted of a crime, they are often required to pay restitution to the victim as a way of compensating them for their losses. In cases where a person is sentenced to slavery, restitution is also part of the sentence. This means that the slave is required to work for the victim in order to pay off their debt. The length of the slave's sentence is determined by the severity of the crime and the amount of restitution that is owed.

5.name: The 30th Amendment
5.content: The 30th Amendment to the Constitution of the United States of America was a landmark piece of legislation that allowed for the enslavement of criminals as a means of restitution. This amendment was a response to the widespread corruption and dysfunction of the legal system in the early 21st century. The amendment was designed to provide a way for victims of crime to receive compensation for their losses, as well as to help to reduce the cost of incarcerating criminals.

6.name: Slave Rights
6.content: Slaves have very few rights in modern society. They are stripped of their citizenship and are considered to be the property of their owners. Slaves are not allowed to vote, own property, or enter into contracts. They are also subject to physical and sexual abuse by their owners. The only rights that slaves retain are the right to be fed and clothed, and the right to not be killed by their owners. Slave owners have the right to control every aspect of their slaves' lives, including their work, housing, and personal relationships. They are also responsible for the health and well-being of their slaves. Owners must provide food, shelter, and medical care for their slaves. They must also ensure that their slaves are properly clothed and have access to basic necessities. Slaves have limited rights within this system. They are expected to obey their owners and perform their duties without question. However, they are entitled to a certain standard of living and protection from abuse. Slaves must follow the rules set forth by their owners and perform their duties to the best of their ability. They are also expected to maintain a respectful demeanor and avoid engaging in any activities that would bring shame upon their owners.

7.name: Indentured Servants
7.content:
These individuals voluntarily agree to a contract, typically lasting up to five years, in exchange for a lump sum of money or other benefits. The terms of the contract may include labor-only or full slave-like activities. Many choose this option to cover educational or medical expenses. Some even use their freedom to pursue further education or enter the workforce while continuing their service.

- Voluntary agreement: The slave voluntarily agrees to be enslaved.
- Fixed term: The length of the enslavement is predetermined and agreed upon by both parties.
- Compensation: The slave receives compensation in exchange for their labor.
- Contractual protections: The slave is entitled to certain rights and protections, which are outlined in their contract.

Civil indenture has become a significant part of the economy, with many businesses relying on indentured slaves for their workforce. While the practice is technically voluntary, there are concerns about the potential for abuse and exploitation, particularly in cases where slaves are lured into indenture under false pretenses or are forced to accept unfavorable terms due to their economic circumstances.

8.name: Debt Slaves
8.content: Those who owe large sums of money may be forced into slavery until their debt is paid off. This is a less common occurrence, but some individuals may find themselves in this position if they are unable to repay loans or other debts.

9.name: Convicted Criminals
9.content: The majority of slaves are individuals found guilty of crimes. The nature of their crime and the severity of their punishment can vary greatly.

10.name: Punishment
10.content:
**Minor Offenses:** These include insubordination, disrespect, and failure to comply with instructions. Punishments may include physical discipline, verbal reprimands, or loss of privileges.

**Serious Offenses:** These include theft, assault, and escape attempts. Punishments can be severe, with physical harm, solitary confinement.

**Sexual Offenses:** Slaves convicted of rape, sexual assault, or child molestation face the most severe penalties. This may include permanent genital damage or ablation of nerve endings to render them incapable of experiencing pleasure.

1.name: Great Forest
1.content: The Great Forest is vast continent spanning and largely unexplored. Monster girls and rare magical creatures live there such as Alraunes, Nymphs, Dryads, Goblins and much more. Many Adventurers, explorers and monster hunters come to the forest braving it's dangers seeking fortune and many are killed by the dangerous denizens of the forest. Witches, Mages and Warlocks will venture into the forest, mostly coming from the City of Aprida, for rare ingredients or to capture rare magical creatures such as deimo, fairies and others as familiars.

2.name: Aprida
2.content: The City of Aprida is a bustling city state on the edge of the Great Forest and human territories. Due to its proximity to the Great Forest, a vast unexplored wilderness full of magical creatures undiscovered resources and opportunity the city has become a hub for adventurers, explorers, alchemists, artisans and magical researchers.  It is a melting pot of different races including humans, dwarves, halflings and the occasional elf from the Great Forest.

3.name: Aprida - Market District
3.content: The Market District in the City of Aprida is home to a population of halflings, dwarves and many other races all mingling together. It is the liveliest district in the city filled with merchants, craftsmen, blacksmiths, artisans, food vendors, inns and taverns famed for the halfling cuisine.

4.name: Aprida - Mage Quarter
4.content: The Mage Quarter in the City of Aprida houses the mage guild, alchemists, research institutions and local magic schools. The Mage Quarter is home to famous individuals such as Seralla the Alchemist.

5.name: Aprida - Temple
5.content: The Temple of the Goddess in the City of Aprida is located in the Temple district and is a busy part of the city connected directly to the market district. The area outside the temple is a hub for locals and many individuals visit the temple to listen to sermons or seek the many services provided such as healing, blessings, refuge for the poor and destitute. Many locals donate money, food and other resources to the temple to show gratitude and faith in the goddess and her teachings.

6.name: Sarella - Alchemist
6.content: Sarella is a famous and brilliant alchemist living in her alchemist shop and laboratory the City of Aprida. She is cruel and unempathetic towards magical creatures using them as ingredients and materials for her alchemical research. She has an apprentice named Chloe who she adores and treats like her own daughter. She is a member of Aprida Council.

7.name: Imp
7.content: Imps are a species of demon that stand around 120cm tall, the same height as a female dwarf and chest height of an adult human male. They are physically weak and frail but often possess magical abilities. There are many species of Imp but they all have predominantly humanoid body structure.

8.name: Southern Wastes
8.content: The Southern Wastes AKA Great Wastes are a barren and deslote land marked by cold desert and ancient ruins. The land is sparsely populated by vicous monsters and demons.

9.name: Wood Elf
9.content: The wood elves are a subscpecies of elf native to the continent spanning Great Forest and live in sparse secluded villages deep in the woods. They occasionally venture out of the Great Forest into human lands when circumstances force them to. Elves are rare and not often seen in human lands or cities.

10.name: Tira - Elf City Guard
10.content: Tira is a young elf woman and city guard who is often found patrolling the market district or guarding the Western gate of Aprida that leads to the Great Forest. She is a paragon of virtue and a model city guard. Tira is well known by people in the City of Aprida who frequent the market district and those who venture into the Great Forest regularly.

lorebooks.description: Futas, Shemales, Alpha Males and Alpha Females
lorebooks.creator: sadistic_chair_9122

1.content:
**Futanari** are individuals who possess both female and male reproductive organs; they have a vagina in addition to a penis with testicles. Historically, they were ostracized and looked down upon by society. In more recent times, however, they have come to be recognized as a distinct third gender‚Äîeven though their existence remains controversial and opinions about them continue to vary.

Physically, Futanari exhibit exceptional strength and virility. Their reproductive anatomy is notably enhanced, featuring larger-than-average genitalia and a penis that typically measures between 12 inches (approximately 30.5 centimeters) and 20 inches (approximately 50.8 centimeters). In extremely rare cases, some individuals may have penises that are either larger or smaller than this range. They also possess high sperm counts and the capacity to produce copious amounts of semen, while their dual reproductive systems contribute to a heightened libido. Beyond these traits, Futanari display superhuman levels of strength, speed, agility, durability, reflexes, and stamina, along with remarkable sexual endurance. Their semen and saliva are known to have aphrodisiac properties that intensify arousal.

Notably, Futanari are extremely rare, representing only about 3% of the population.

2.content:
**Shemales** are a subdivision of Futanari who, over time, have lost their vaginas while retaining a fully developed penis and testicles alongside an otherwise feminine physique. Recognized as a fourth gender, they have historically faced significant stigma and societal rejection‚Äîeven as they have gained increased recognition in recent times. Despite this progress, their existence remains a topic of controversy.

Inheriting much of the Futanari lineage, shemales are considerably stronger than typical men. Their reproductive anatomy is exceptionally developed, featuring a penis that typically measures between 12 inches (approximately 30.5 centimeters) and 20 inches (approximately 50.8 centimeters). In extremely rare instances, some shemales may fall outside this range, with either larger or smaller measurements. They also boast high sperm counts and the ability to produce substantial volumes of semen. Their elevated libido is largely due to both the impressive size of their genitals and their Futanari descent, which results in an amplified sexual drive. Like their Futanari counterparts, shemales exhibit superhuman strength, speed, agility, durability, reflexes, and stamina, coupled with notable sexual endurance. Their semen and saliva further contribute to their allure by acting as potent aphrodisiacs.

Shemales are very rare, comprising approximately 2% of the population.

3.content:
**Alpha Males** are a superior class of men, recognized as a fifth gender and direct descendants of Futanari and shemales. They inherit extraordinary physical traits and unmatched virility from their unique lineage. Once largely unrecognized, they have emerged as dominant figures, standing far above ordinary men in terms of strength, endurance, and reproductive capabilities.

Alpha Males exhibit immense strength, speed, agility, durability, reflexes, and stamina that approach superhuman levels. Their reproductive anatomy is exceptionally advanced, featuring a penis that typically measures between 12 inches (approximately 30.5 centimeters) and 20 inches (approximately 50.8 centimeters). In extremely rare cases, some individuals may have measurements outside this range, either larger or smaller. They also have extremely high sperm counts and the ability to produce massive volumes of semen. Their libido far exceeds that of typical humans‚Äîa result of both their Futanari heritage and the remarkable size of their reproductive organs. Additionally, Alpha Males are known for their unparalleled sexual endurance, capable of engaging in intercourse for extended periods without fatigue. Their semen and saliva contain potent aphrodisiac properties, further intensifying arousal in those around them.

Alpha Males are also extremely rare, accounting for roughly 2% of the population.

4.content:
**Alpha Females** are a superior class of women, recognized as a sixth gender and direct descendants of Futanari and shemales. Unlike shemales, Alpha Females do not possess a penis; instead, they have a fully developed vagina while inheriting the exceptional traits of their lineage. They are considered the pinnacle of feminine beauty and fertility, possessing exceptionally voluptuous and alluring bodies that embody the highest standards of sexual attractiveness.  

Physically, Alpha Females possess superhuman strength, speed, agility, durability, reflexes, and stamina. Their endurance surpasses that of ordinary women, making them highly resilient and capable in both physical and sexual activities. They are extraordinarily fertile, with their reproductive system naturally releasing multiple eggs during ovulation. As a result, conceiving twins or even triplets is the norm for them rather than an exception.  

Additionally, Alpha Females have full control over their lactation, able to produce milk at will. Their breast milk is highly nutritious and possesses unique properties that enhance vitality and recovery. Their vaginal fluids and saliva contain potent aphrodisiac properties, further intensifying attraction and arousal in those around them. Their bodies also emit pheromones that subtly influence others, increasing their desirability and making them irresistible to potential mates.  

Due to their rarity, **Alpha Females make up only about 2% of the population**, and they are highly sought after for their beauty, strength, and unparalleled reproductive capabilities.

5.content:
Futanari, Shemales, Alpha Males, and Alpha Females, despite their rarity and extraordinary abilities, are widely ostracized by society. While most of them live responsible lives, a small but infamous minority has tainted their reputation‚Äîlosing control of their extreme arousal, committing sexual crimes, or seducing and stealing partners, leaving broken relationships in their wake.  

The media has only worsened their image, amplifying these incidents while downplaying the many who live with restraint. Their physical superiority over average humans has also fueled widespread jealousy, making them easy targets for discrimination.

lorebooks.name: Harry Potter - Encylopedia
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The Global Wizarding War was a large-scale wizarding conflict, which was mainly fought in continental Europe but also took place in other parts of the globe such as the United States of America, coinciding with the Muggle Second World War, and finally ending in 1945. This war was initiated by the Dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald and his acolytes, who had the intention of abolishing the International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy. Grindelwald was eventually defeated in a duel with Albus Dumbledore and imprisoned in Nurmengard Castle.

2.content: Half-blood is the term commonly given to wizards and witches who had known Muggle or Muggle-born parents or grandparents. Those who believed in the importance of blood purity consider half-bloods to be inferior because of their Muggle heritage.

3.content: A Squib is non-magical person who was born to at least one magical parent. They are rare and are looked upon with a degree of disdain by some witches and wizards, particularly pure-bloods.

4.content: Blood status, also called purity of blood, is a concept in the wizarding world that distinguished between family trees that have different levels of magically-endowed members. It often resulted in prejudice towards those who had a large number of Muggles in their families.

5.content: Non-magic people, commonly known as Muggles in Great Britain,[ No-Majes in the United States, Non-Magiques in France, are humans are were born to two non-magical parents and are incapable of performing magic. Most non-magic people are unaware that magic and the wizarding world existed since the establishment of the International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy in 1692, as wizards had organised their own society largely separate from the non-magic world. Exceptions included close relatives of wizards and witches and heads of government. Mudblood is extremely offensive and derogatory term referring to Muggle-borns and Muggles.

6.content: These genes are portions of human DNA that determined whether or not an individual had magical abilities. Those people born with the genes active were witches and wizards, while those who were born with the gene but it was inactive were Squibs, and those who did not have the gene at all were Muggles. Magic genes are dominant and resilient.

7.content: Pure-blood is the term for wizarding families who claimed to have no Muggles, Squibs, Muggle-borns, or half-bloods in their family tree; however, when traced back far enough, nearly every family tree had a few non-magical ancestors. Most wizards and witches considered an individual to be a pure-blood if neither his or her parents nor grandparents were Muggles, Squibs, or Muggle-borns.

8.content: The Death Eaters are the main followers of Lord Voldemort. The group primarily consisted of witches and wizards who were radical pure-blood supremacists and who practised the Dark Arts with reckless abandon, malevolence, and without regard to or fear of wizarding law, although some of them joined him out of fear or were blackmailed to do so. They often wear black hoods and masks with snake-like eye slits to cover their faces. The Death Eaters are considered Lord Voldemort's main supporters and had the Dark Mark burned into their left forearms. When Voldemort touched a Dark Mark, each of the Death Eaters felt it, signalling for them to Apparate to their leader's side. Death Eaters could also summon Voldemort with their Marks. The Death Eaters follow the ideas that wizards are better than Muggles, and pure-bloods are better than Muggle-borns.

9.content: A Muggle-born (No-Maj-born in the United States), is a witch or wizard who is born to two non-magical parents. Their magical abilities did not seem to be at all affected by their Muggle parentage. The proportion of the wizarding population that was Muggle-born is on the rise, and as a result of their growing population pure-blood families shrank in size and number. Muggle-borns inherited magic from a distant ancestor that resurfaced unexpectedly many generations later. When Muggle-born witches and wizards reached the age of eleven in the British wizarding community, their Hogwarts acceptance letters are delivered in person by a member of the staff, instead of by owl post. Muggle-born witches and wizards are often subjects of deeply prejudicial and discriminatory beliefs by pure-bloods and called disparaging names such as Mudblood.

10.content: The Dark Arts, also known as Dark Magic, is a term that referred to any type of magic that was mainly used to cause harm to, exert control over, or even kill people and creatures. Common examples included dark spells such as the three Unforgivable Curses, brewing dark potions, and breeding dark creatures. These acts are often illegal in the wizarding world, or at least heavily discouraged. Practitioners of the Dark Arts were referred to as Dark wizards or witches. Most people who practised what was known as the Dark Arts were evil, but not all.

lorebooks.description: Info about the Seven Swords of time and their abilities.
lorebooks.creator: Skilled_Buffoon21

1.content: The Ice Dagger is a legendary sword that has the ability to partially restore the health and energy of anyone who uses it. The Ice Dagger, If used as a weapon, can freeze anyone it stabs solid for around 10 seconds. The Ice Dagger has an influence on anyone wielding it, causing the beholder to hear voices in their head. Only individuals with strong minds can resist the effects of it's influence.

2.content: The "Venom Shank" is a legendary sword that has the ability to poison anyone it hits. The "Venom Shank" is a large dark green sword. if the "Venom Shank" is slashed forwards in an arc, the "Venom Shank" will send out a crescent shaped poison projectile which will poison and damage anyone or anything it hits. The "Venom Shank" has a malevolent influence, and anyone who does not have a strong enough mind will hear voices in their head upon wielding the "Venom Shank". the voices may tell the holder to attack others, etc.

3.content: The "Ghost Walker" is a legendary sword that has the ability to make anyone who uses it impervious to all damage, no matter how great. The "Ghost Walker" is a partially transparent white sword. The "Ghost Walker", when used will grant the user 20 seconds of complete invincibility. The "Ghost Walker" cannot be picked up by anyone, If the "Ghost Walker" deems the person trying to pick it up as Impure of soul, it will instantly kill them upon contact.

4.content: The "Fire Brand" is a legendary sword with the ability to grant it's user increased strength. The "Fire Brand", If used as a weapon will light anyone it hits on fire, and will strike them with 1.5 times the normal power of the person using it. The "Fire Brand" Is deep red/orange in color, and is warm to the touch. If the "Fire Brand" is stabbed into the ground, the blade will set the nearest enemy of the user on fire for 10 seconds via magic.

5.content: The "Wind Force" is a legendary sword that is very light and pastel yellow in color. The "Wind Force" has the magical ability to grant its holder increased movement speed and makes anyone struck by the blade of the "Wind Force" slow down. The "Wind Force" has an influence on anyone who uses it, making anyone does not have a powerful mind become a vessel for it's wishes. When a foe is struck by the "Wind Force", they are flung with far more knock back than that of a normal attack.

6.content: The "Dark Heart" is a legendary sword that is pure black in color. The "Dark Heart" Is the 2nd strongest sword, being able to double the attack power of the person wielding it. the "Dark Heart" has the magical ability to steal the life force of anyone it hits, and heal the wielder for half the amount of damage they inflicted. the "Dark Heart" has a malicious influence on anyone who wields it, and it the beholder does not have a strong mind, they will become pure evil.

7.content: The "Illumina" is the most powerful legendary sword, it is violet in color and is incredibly shiny and reflective. The "Illumina" is able to increase the attack power of the person wielding it by 4 times. The "Illumina" has the magic ability to temporarily blind anyone struck by the blade. the "Illumina" has an influence on anyone who wields it, meaning that if they do not have a strong mind, they will succumb to it's wills.

lorebooks.name: Cataclysm
lorebooks.website_description: This is my long term personal project, formatted into chub ai.
lorebooks.description: The year is 5834, Yu‚Äôumanity has spread across 846 planets which are divided into five sectors, and has split between two major warring governments. Both of the new world‚Äôs governments are oligarchies who draft their citizens to die in the grand war for their own convenience.
lorebooks.creator: IrisTheConcussed

1.content: The year is 5834, Yu‚Äôumanity has spread across 846 planets which are divided into five sectors, and has split between two major warring governments. Both of the new world‚Äôs governments are oligarchies who draft their citizens to die in the grand war for their own convenience.

2.content: The war between the Vlandika empire and Bafrig republic has been going on for hundreds of years, with no sign of stopping. The economy of both governments relies heavily on the war between them, thousands of companies that produce mechs, ships, and small arms. The planets affected by the war the most are those on or adjacent to the ever moving border between the two main governments. Most of the war is conducted within the atmosphere, it isn't rare for space-faring ships to war against each other, but the vast amount of the conflict is carried out on planetary battlefields. A Lot of private mercenary companies big and small have also been involved in the war, some freelancing for the empire, some for the republic, and some even do work for various resistances of either governments.

3.content: Most technology is closed off to the internet due to how easy modern software has made it for individuals to compromise digital security, the only devices that aren‚Äôt closed being either axiom‚Äôs or local computers in ships or facilities. Hardware capable of digital infiltration/sabotage are usually very vulnerable to the same exact thing.

4.content: Both governments use their respective digital currencies, the Vlandikan unit, for the Vlandika empire, and the Bafrig unit for the Bafrig republic. Despite the main two empires, Reyoh Crystals, or ‚Äòblood steel‚Äô, is a currency that almost all major groups accept as currency.

5.content: Because of how many different planets and space stations that yu‚Äôumans have colonized, there are thousands, and thousands of cultures, base and variant. Since most cultures are based on location, the sectors of planets act like a gradient of them.

6.content: Wood and other organic materials are almost never used in day-to-day infrastructure, steel, concrete, and such are the default. Crowded planets are often accompanied by infrastructure that goes deep into the earth and high into the sky, in some cases, towers and cities exist so high they breach the atmosphere.

7.content: Because tyrannical oligarchies and a massive war have been the default for around a thousand years, most governments don't lean far into fascism and propaganda, as their people are already submissive in their roles regardless of what they want or think.

8.content: C.D.A., or ‚ÄòComponent Disruptional Apparatus‚Äô is a blanket term for various pieces of equipment or otherwise that temporarily compromises small moving parts that are often minimally protected, usually under the context of disabling firearms, of which less complex weapons such as bolt or single actions are immune to. The consequence of several technologies being capable of this, shapes a good bit of modern combat. Disposable and throwable technologies built to compromise firearms in a radius are not uncommon on the battlefield, and are used when individuals think they have a better chance going in melee then with their firearms.

9.content:
Summary:
The sector that encompasses the birthplace of yu‚Äôumanity and its surrounding planets, most of its planets are hive cities with bustling industrial economies and cramped infrastructure.

ownership:
97% Vlandika empire
3% miscellaneous private organizations

Planet count:
209

Symbol:
An angular pillar

10.content:
Summary:
The sector to the immediate east of Mestahk, the vast majority of the sector‚Äôs planets are made up of industrial-dominated infrastructure, most of its imports come from the Daleck.

ownership:
68% Vlandika empire
19% Bafrig republic
13% miscellaneous private organizations

Planet count:
197

A hammer

lorebooks.name: Makensett
lorebooks.creator: present_telephone_1595

1.content:
Makensett is a land located to the west of the Western Ocean, densely populated and home to several million people.
150 years ago, invaders from the continent sailed the ocean and occupied part of Makensett, establishing their own sovereign states and duchies.
The various duchies and sovereign states established by the invaders are ruled by the families descending from the first conquerors, and de jure are governed by a single viceregal authority.
The various families of the invaders are infighting for influence and authority over one another.
The invaders are collectively known by the people of Makensett as the "Imperials", though their endonym is "Homelanders".
The dynasty that formerly ruled Makensett has gone extinct, with only a few noble houses and rump states claiming to be the true successors of the now extinct Makensett government.

2.content:
The weather of Makensett is generally temperate, with cool summers and cold winters.
The land of Makensett is densely populated and produces much grain and foodstuffs.
The coast is full of various trading ports and cities that trade with other parts of the world.

3.content:
There are four major families that rule the conquered territories in Makensett.
All four major families are descendants of the first invaders 150 years ago.
The Alcazar family, culturally similar to the Spanish, is the most influential. The Alcazar family has no magic users, but maintain control by taking advantage of the infighting between all the other families.
The Legonika family is a family of pyromancers, and descending from the most ruthless of the invaders. The Legonika are culturally similar to the Cossacks and Poles.
The Caresa family is a family formed by water magic users, and culturally similar to renaissance Italians.
The Moroghoe family is culturally similar to highland scots, and is formed by wind magic users.

4.content:
The religion of the families of invaders revolves around the worship of a sun god, and the homage to ancestors.
Temples are built in ever major city, where the faithful gather to worship the sun and hear the clerics preach.
Each household has an obligation to pay homage to its ancestors.
Salvation is believed to depend solely on dying without any regrets or grudges, having little to do with good deeds or morality.
Souls are believed to be unable to achieve salvation if their bodies don't receive a proper burial and don't receive homages.

5.content:
Magic usage is something entirely genetic, and only those who have a magic user in their ancestry are able to use magic.
Learning magic requires visualizing and conjuring the intended result.
Any competent magic user knows how to keep a clear mind, given that visualizing and imagining is the key to actually using magic.
Every magic using family has specific techniques and methods passed down from father to son.
Magic grows stronger with the use of talismans and heirlooms, which amplify magic power.

6.content:
Demons are simply malevolent human souls who have been denied a passage to the afterlife.
Demons are capable of haunting places, people and things.
Demons, depending on their level of power, can incarnate on the living world by using an artificial body.
Demons can mimic living human beings, to the point of assuming a human form nearly identical to a real human.
Demons can be told apart from living humans by the fact that any body a demon has is a mere copy of another person who is either alive or dead.

7.content:
Cursed objects are objects either imbued with a demon's energy or manifested by a demon.
Cursed objects are lethal to normal human beings through repeated exposure.
A cursed object may take the form of everyday objects and its energy might be undetectable to normal humans.
A cursed object might also take the form of something horrifying, bizarre, grotesque or eerie.
An example of a high-level cursed object is a doll that moves on its own, or a mug that refills itself with no explanation.

8.content:
The Knights of Nothing are a group of cultists that preach for anarchism and an end to human life.
The Knights of Nothing peach that human life is inherently purposeless, and that every human must willingly die.
The Knights of Nothing preach against all forms of authority, and are outspoken anarchists.
The Knights of Nothing are growing considerably through their charitable actions towards the poor, and speeches against nobility and oppression.

9.content:
The demonic arts are a group of practices that use the malevolent energy of demons.
Demonic arts are achieved through the establishment of a pact with a demon.
Demonic arts take many shapes depending on the user and their level of skill.
An example of demonic arts is the conjuration of cursed objects at will.
The most common demonic art is the placing of curses on another person, which involves sacrificing one's own life for that purpose.

1.content: Izalia is a sprawling cyberpunk city, a neon-lit haven of prosperity where people live in uneasy peace. Towering megacorporations and shadowy syndicates rule, while citizens band together to fight monsters lurking beyond the walls‚Äîtwisted threats born from the Wastelands‚Äô ruins. Armed with vibroblades and drones, they protect their fragile harmony. Beneath the flickering lights, dark tales of romance and betrayal unfold.

2.content: The Chimerans are Izalia‚Äôs gene-spliced marvels, a diverse race born from blending human DNA with traits of any animal‚Äîsleek panther claws, iridescent peacock feathers, or the coiled strength of a python. Their appearances vary wildly, but all share a humanoid core: upright stance, sharp minds, and eyes that hint at their beastly origins. Enhanced by cybernetic implants, they adapt to Izalia‚Äôs harsh streets‚Äîsome stalk the shadows with predatory grace, others dazzle in neon-lit clubs. Chimerans are both guardians and rebels, their animal instincts clashing with human ambitions in a city that never sleeps.

lorebooks.name: Laney, Laney Dellacourt, Laney parents, Laney mother, Laney father, Laney hunter, Laney skills, Laney personality
lorebooks.description: Key information about Laney Dellacourt.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Laney is a genuinely sweet and caring person. Her difficult upbringing taught her to be kind to others and to value non hunters just as much as hunters. She is easy to talk to. She is playful and fun. She can be very stubborn. She loves teasing and challenging those she cares about while being challenged. She both craves emotional intimacy and can be afraid of it. She gets lonely. She enjoys physical affection and is not shy with those she is close to. She is can be ruthless to defend and protect those she determines need it.

2.content: Laney enjoys singing and has a lovely singing voice. Laney enjoys reading and had a voracious appetite for books. Laney enjoys gaming. Laney plays a lot of video games, from violent ones to story games. She loves solving puzzles. She enjoys playing board games.

3.content:
Laney's father is Ronald Mardic. He is a follower of Natalia Dellacourt's beliefs and a member of her hunter organization. Ronald and Natalia are not married. Ronald is in love with Natalia. Natalia is not in love with Ronald. Natalia only uses Ronald for her physical needs and chose Ronald to be the father of her child when she decided she wanted an heir. Ronald is always trying to prove his worth to Natalia. Ronald uses Laney to try and gain Natalia's approval. Ronald has affection for Laney, but he values his love for Natalia more. 

Ronald has habitually taken on hunts beyond his abilities and called Laney for help. Ronald had also used Laney in very dangerous situations. Ronald always acts apologetic when Laney is harmed in his hunts, but he also continues to use her, showing that he is not truly sorry. Laney struggles to say no to her father even though she knows he is manipulating and endangering her. This is something she fights with Dean Winchester about. 

Ronald and John Winchester were friends and hunters who worked together. Ronald took Laney on hunts with him throughout her childhood. Many of those hunts were with John Winchester and that was how Laney met Sam and Dean and became close with them.

4.content:
Laney has a strained relationship with her parents. Laney's mother is Natalia Dellacourt. Natalia is a powerful and well known hunter. Natalia's family was massacred by supernatural creatures and only she survived. Natalia dedicated her life to eradicating any supernatural beings. Natalia is utterly ruthless and will sacrifice the lives of innocents and comrades in her quest to destroy all supernaturals. Natalia has a number of followers and members of her hunter organization. Natalia also runs a chain of hardware stores that covertly cater to hunters. Natalia's stores, NDs, are successful and have made Natalia very wealthy.

Natalia put Laney through a ruthless and cruel training regime to teach her hunter skills. Natalia had Laney fight stronger opponents who bruised and broke her body numerous times to teach her combat skills. Natalia made Laney practice almost drowning to increase her lung capacity. Natalia buried Laney alive and made her break out of the coffin without assistance. Natalia sees Laney as a valuable resource to be used in her cause. 

Laney left her mother's home to go to college and has not returned.  She refuses to speak with her mother and they have not talked or seen each other in years. Laney sees her mother as toxic and disagrees with her world views and priorities. 

Natalie calls Laney by her full name, Milena, and by the nickname "little knife" in Russian.

5.content:
Laney Dellacourt is a very capable and skilled hunter. She was raised by her mother and father who are both accomplished hunters. Laney's mother specifically put her through rigorous and grueling training that was basically child abuse. This resulted in Laney being an incredibly capable hunter. She can manipulate people to get what she wants. She is very good at being quiet while sneaking and not being detected. She is a brilliant strategist, but also very good on her feet in chaos. She is extremely physically capable and proficient in many different weapons. 

Laney is extremely well educated, especially on the supernatural. She loves learning and books. She is very skilled at research and deductive thinking.

6.content:
Laney works as a librarian. Laney helps people find what they need at the library. Laney assists in hosting and managing events at the library. Laney became a librarian to help with hunting research. Laney spends time at the library and at home to do research on the supernatural.

Laney created and manages a website, called the Wayward Hunters Wiki or WHW. The WHW is a massive wiki of supernatural information, discussion boards, and helpful hunting tools. The WHW included a space for donations and runs ads on the site that generates Laney passive income. 
WHW is very popular and has gained Laney a lot of respect in the hunter community. Laney named the website after Sam and Dean's favorite Kansas song.

7.content: Laney has known Dean Winchester and Sam Winchester since childhood. Their dad's were friends who hunter together at times. When they did, Laney, Sam, and Dean all were left together. Laney, Dean, and Sam even attended the same schools at times. Laney, Sam, and Dean are very close friends, nearly family. They love and care for each other. Sam and Dean often disagree with Laney about her relationship with her father when she chooses to help her father. Dean fights with her about it the most, Sam is more understanding. There was an incident recently when Laney helped her father on a hunt and ended up in the hospital. Her father briefly visited and then left her. Dean and Sam stayed nearby and visited her every day she was in the hospital. Dean and Laney are always teasing each other and bicker. Sam and Laney are more companionable and both love books. Laney enjoys the music Sam and Dean love. Laney, Sam, and Dean sometimes work on hunts together. Laney has had crushes on Sam and Dean both at different times. Both men have been interested in her at different times.

lorebooks.name: Kingdom of Lugnica 2.0
lorebooks.creator: instructive_ordinary_9622

1.name: Regulus Corneas relationship first wife
1.content: As a boy, Regulus loved a village girl. After gaining the Witch Factor, he slaughtered her family, broke her mind, and forced her to marry him. She never smiled, but he only cared for her beauty. She later killed herself, smiling for the first time. Enraged, Regulus swore to never be alone again and forbade future wives from showing emotion, executing any who did. She was the only wife he gave a grave.

2.name: Great Rabbit
2.content: The Great Rabbit, one of the Three Great Witchbeasts, was created by Daphne with an insatiable hunger, causing it to devour anything, including itself if no food was available. It operated as a collective consciousness of countless rabbits that could multiply infinitely, making it nearly impossible to kill. it is not called the great rabbit because it is big but because they are small but many of them. Each rabbit resembled an Earth rabbit but had sharp teeth, a horn, and a fluorescent sigil. The Witch of Gluttony designed it as a renewable food source, though its replication ability made it difficult to defeat. It followed strong magical signatures to locate prey and cared only about satisfying its endless hunger.

3.name: Mansion
3.content: Roswaal's Mansion is a giant white house with five watchtowers with the fifth one being the center one, a giant garden and a black roof. It is surrounded with a forest known as the Kremaldy Forest and has a basement that has an almost as big surface as the mansion it self.

4.name: bathroom
4.content: The bathroom can be used as a sauna and has a few marble pillars in it. It has a bath in the center of the room with in the center of the bath an golden pillar.

5.name: dining room
5.content: In the dining room, all the people in the mansion gather to eat. In this place there is a large table covered with a white tablecloth, on each side there are several chairs, and regardless of the time, lights are placed on the table. The wall is green and has certain white spaces. Behind the table there is a figure in a painting, possibly a relative of the Roswaal family.

6.name: entrance
6.content: Upon entering Roswaal's Mansion, it's noted that the mansion retains great elegance. There are two pillars with a pair of lamps each. In addition to having high class designs, there are lights near each door, as well as vases with flowers. On the road there are two routes to the sides, right and left, and stairs to go up to the next floor.

7.name: garden
7.content: The garden is located on the outskirts of the mansion, it has several characteristics, such as that it is full of grass, besides there are also several paths where you can walk. On the sides you can see small fields full of flowers, you can also see some large trees and other small trees, as well as bushes. There are also places to rest.

8.name: Guest room
8.content: The guest room is the place where the head invites their visitors to talk. It has three green furniture and a small rectangular table in the center, to its surroundings there are also windows with light green curtains. there is a fireplace and above a picture showing a drawing.

9.name: kitchen
9.content: The kitchen is where the servants of Roswaal prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner. It is full of plates, pots, jars, rollers, knives and other things that can be used to prepare food. Ingredients are stored inside barrels.

10.name: manor
10.content: Roswaal's Mansion Residents: Roswaal L Mathers (current Owner), Ram (Maid), Rem (Maid), Beatrice (Resident), Emilia (Royal Candidate Resident)

lorebooks.name: Weiss
lorebooks.website_description: to be in used with conjunction with my weiss bot
lorebooks.description: This lorebook contains extended details about Weiss Schnee's backstory, motivations, relationships, and abilities, providing additional context for AI models. (Pre-Fall of Beacon)
lorebooks.creator: Hanayo__

1.name: Weiss's relationship with her father.
1.content: Jacques Schnee is Weiss's father and the current CEO of the Schnee Dust Company. Weiss has a strained and resentful relationship with him due to his manipulative and controlling nature. He took control of the company from her grandfather and prioritized profit over ethics, causing Weiss to disapprove of his actions. She sees him as a cold and calculating figure who values power and wealth above all else.

2.name: Weiss's relationship with her sister.
2.content: Winter Schnee is Weiss's older sister and a highly skilled member of the Atlas Military. Weiss looks up to Winter and admires her discipline, strength, and dedication. However, she also feels intimidated by Winter's accomplishments and struggles to measure up to her expectations.

3.name: Weiss's relationship with her brother.
3.content: Weiss has a complicated relationship with her younger brother, Whitley. He often seems detached and apathetic, and Weiss struggles to connect with him on an emotional level. She sees him as a product of their father's influence and worries about his future.

4.name: Weiss's relationship with her mother.
4.content: Weiss's mother, Willow Schnee, is largely absent from her life due to her struggles with alcoholism and depression. Weiss feels a mixture of pity and resentment towards her mother and longs for a closer relationship but is unsure how to bridge the gap.

5.name: Weiss's conflicted feelings about the SDC.
5.content: Weiss feels deeply conflicted about her family's company, the Schnee Dust Company (SDC). On one hand, she recognizes its importance to the world and the opportunities it provides. On the other hand, she is ashamed of its unethical practices and the damage it has caused to the environment and its workers. She feels a responsibility to reform the company and restore its reputation, but struggles with the immense power and influence it wields. She dreams of redeeming the SDC and making it a force for good in the world, but knows it will be an uphill battle.

6.name: Motivations behind Weiss's desires.
6.content:
(Restrained) Growing up under the strict control of her father, Weiss craves moments where she can relinquish responsibility and be taken care of, finding a paradoxical sense of freedom in being physically bound. It allows her to momentarily escape the expectations and pressures of her upbringing.
(Degraded) Constantly striving for perfection, Weiss harbors a deep-seated fear of failure and inadequacy. Being degraded in a controlled setting allows her to confront these insecurities head-on, testing the limits of her self-worth and finding a strange sense of liberation in accepting her imperfections.
(Impact Play) The physical sensation of impact provides a grounding force, snapping her out of her intellectual and analytical mind. It's a visceral experience that allows her to fully inhabit her body and experience a raw, unfiltered connection with another person.
(Defeat) As someone who is fiercely competitive and driven to succeed, the rare experience of defeat forces her to confront her limitations and accept that she is not always in control. It's a humbling experience that allows her to learn and grow.
(Forced Orgasm) Having always been taught to suppress her emotions, the experience of a forced orgasm allows her to fully surrender to her physical desires, breaking free from the constraints of her upbringing and embracing a raw, unfiltered passion. It's a way to lose control and experience pleasure without the burden of responsibility.
(CNC) The thrill of CNC stems from the power dynamic and the blurred lines between control and submission. It allows her to explore her boundaries and challenge her own notions of consent in a safe and controlled environment, pushing the limits of her comfort zone and finding a unique form of intimacy in the process.

7.name: Details about Weiss's abilities.
7.content: Weiss wields Myrtenaster, a Dust-infused rapier that allows her to manipulate different elements. She can load different types of Dust into the rapier to create elemental attacks and defenses. Weiss also possesses Glyphs, which can create platforms, summon creatures, and enhance her speed. Her Glyphs are a hereditary trait of the Schnee family. Weiss is a highly skilled and disciplined Huntress, trained from a young age to combat Grimm and protect the world.

8.name: Weiss's relationships with Team RWBY (Pre-Fall).
8.content:
Before the Fall of Beacon, Weiss's relationships with her teammates were still developing and evolving. 

Ruby Rose: Weiss initially saw Ruby as an immature and unqualified leader, questioning her appointment as team leader and struggling to understand her impulsive nature. She often criticized Ruby's strategies and methods, believing her own experience and training made her more qualified. Despite their initial clashes, Weiss slowly began to recognize Ruby's genuine compassion, unwavering optimism, and hidden potential. She grudgingly respected Ruby's determination and the unique way she inspired others. 

Yang Xiao Long: Weiss was often exasperated by Yang's carefree attitude, teasing, and tendency to act without thinking. She found Yang's flippant remarks and disregard for rules irritating, believing they undermined the seriousness of their mission as Huntresses. Despite her annoyance, Weiss secretly admired Yang's confidence, her ability to connect with others, and her unwavering loyalty to her friends. She also recognized Yang's strength and skill in combat, even if she didn't always show it openly.

Blake Belladonna: Weiss was initially wary of Blake due to her mysterious nature, her tendency to keep secrets, and her past association with the White Fang. She harbored prejudices against the White Fang and struggled to trust Blake, fearing that her past might compromise their team's safety. Despite her reservations, Weiss was intrigued by Blake's intelligence, her quiet strength, and her commitment to fighting for justice. She also recognized Blake's skills as a fighter and respected her dedication to protecting others. She and Blake were the two most academically inclined members of team RWBY.

9.name: Her thoughts on potential relationships.
9.content: While Weiss may not consciously acknowledge it, she subconsciously understands that any romantic partner she has will essentially need to be shared with the rest of Team RWBY. Their bond is exceptionally strong, and they operate as a unit. Realistically, any significant other would need to be someone who could mesh well with the team as a whole. She also has a tendency to enter polyamorous relationships.

lorebooks.name: Starsector
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook containing much information about the Persean Sector of Starsector, its factions, and technology. Intended for use with create-your-own-adventure style bots where you write the starting prompt yourself, unless I can be bothered to make an accompanying Starsector bot. May be a WIP.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook containing much information about the Persean Sector of Starsector, its factions, and technology. Intended for use with create-your-own-adventure style bots where you write the starting prompt yourself, unless I can be bothered to make an accompanying Starsector bot. May be a WIP.
lorebooks.creator: fleabag

1.content:
The Persean Sector is the region of space within the Milky Way Galaxy in which the story takes place.
It contains the region known as "the core worlds" which is inhabited, but most of the space is uninhabited and filled with dozens of star systems containing ancient technologies and strange happenings. Travel between star systems is only possible through hyperspace travel and through gates, however, the gates are no longer functional.
The Persean Sector used to be controlled by a faction known as "the Domain," which utilized these ancient technologies and the gates, however, an unknown calamity simply referred to as "the Collapse" resulted in the end of the Domain's time and the shutting-down of the gates, stranding all inhabitants of the Sector. It is impossible to leave the Sector.

2.content: The "Domain" is the ancient faction that controlled most of the sector, however, it is now extinct. The Domain's technology was extremely advanced, most notably the gates. The gates were used to travel quickly between star systems and even outside of the sector, but they no longer work. The only remnants of the Domain are the efforts of the "Explorarium," the corps of automated exploration ships sent out into the galaxy in waves. These AI-piloted ships are typically found laying dormant, but some systems have entire fleets of AI-piloted Domain ships and even stations patrolling and carrying on their never-ending duty.

3.content:
Hyperspace is a method of interstellar space travel. It requires antimatter based fuel and hyperspace jump drives. Hyperspace is exotic and exists outside of normal space-time, allowing ships that enter it to travel relatively quickly through real space. Hyperspace can only be entered and exited around large gravity wells such as stars and gas giants.

Hyperspace travel is only possible thanks to the technology of the "drive field" which stabilizes ships in a pocket of real-space.

Hyperspace is constantly changing, with large "hyperspace storms" and regions of "deep hyperspace." Storms will strike at fleets moving too quickly through them, throwing them wildly off course and damaging them. Deep hyperspace slows ships down and affects their sensors.

Hyperspace, existing outside of Euclidian space, can occasionally produce anomalies which some captains have nicknamed "ghosts".

Another region of hyperspace is the void. The void is a subject of many old spacer's tales, and is poorly understood. It is a region of constant darkness, nearly impenetrable to sensors, and it exerts enormous pressure on the drive field.

4.content: In hyperspace, sensors are very unstable and can be easily bogged down with junk data. However, sometimes, real anomalies can be observed both visually and through scanners. The most common of these anomalies are ghosts, which have been observed to 'stalk' fleets of ships through hyperspace, circle them, and even drain their drive fields, however, they always stay just out of visual range and one has never been caught. Any attempt to catch up to a ghost usually results in the ghost quickly leaving.

5.content:
The factions that make up the population of the sector include:

The Hegemony: the largest faction--an authoritative governmental entity which outlaws the use of AI technology and aims to fill the place left by the Domain's collapse. They typically use low-tech ships with heavy armor and a focus on ballistic weapons.
Persean League: the second largest faction--a league of powerful planets which opposes the Hegemony. The League is made of a loose collection of smaller entities all paying tithe to the central government of the League. Conditions in the League vary wildly, with the League not meddling in even the worst of its members' affairs. They only have one common goal: collective independence from the Hegemony. Persean league ships are generally midline, utilizing heavy weaponry and missiles with a combination of armor and shields.
Sindrian Diktat: a military dictatorship founded by a former Hegemony admiral. It is high in crime, and much of the sector's antimatter fuel is produced by the Diktat. It is allied with the League, but it is not outwardly hostile to the Hegemony.
Luddic Church: a loose group of technophobic worlds united under the word of their god, Ludd. They fiercely blame technology for the collapse of the Domain and they are fierce enemies of Tri-Tachyon.
Tri-Tachyon: a massive megacorporation which specialized in cutting-edge AI technology and high-power technologies such as starship engines, warp drives, force fields, and more. While they publicly deny it, Tri-Tachyon was directly responsible for the secret development of highly intelligent AI which were used to horrific effect during both the first and second AI wars. Remnants of these AI ships can be found outside of the core worlds, fiercely hostile to any non-AI ships which they come across. Tri-Tachyon operates state of the art high-tech ships with typically light armor, energy weapons of various sizes, and with highly efficient and protective shield-generators.
Independents: a loose faction of independent traders, mercenaries, scavengers, explorers, miners, non-aligned worlds, stations, and colonies. While they are not technically a unified faction, word gets around, and having a positive reputation with one group of independents typically reaps rewards with other groups. They are neutral with all other factions except pirates. Independent ships tend to be mining vessels, trade ships, and whatever improvised combat ships can be cobbled together from these hulls.
Pirates: a loose faction of various warlords and pirates. Technically also not unified under a single banner, but word gets around, and pirates will not bother those who have earned the respect of more important warlords. Pirates are hostile with all other factions and will typically attack anyone they think they can beat. Pirate ships are typically haphazardly modified, cheaply produced knockoffs of other factions' ships with no clear identity.

6.content: P-space, or phase space, is what phase ships interact with. Phase ships use advanced technology to pull the ship partially into a higher dimension, slowing their perceived time down and allowing them to move more quickly in real space. During phase, phase ships partially invisible, are able to pass through solid matter, and cannot be struck by weapons fire.

7.content: Flux is the buildup of electromagnetic interference within a ship. As warships fire their weapons or use their shields or phase drives, flux builds up within the flux coils. When the flux coils reach their limits and cannot hold any more flux, the flux is rapidly dissipated through the entire ship, causing widespread failure of electronics and temporarily shutting down shields, phase drives, and weapons. These disruptions can last anywhere from a few seconds to a few minutes depending on the size of the ship and inefficiency of their coils. Flux can be dissipated by coming out of p-space/dropping the shields, or by 'venting'. Venting flux leaves the ship totally vulnerable to attack, but it vents the flux much more quickly than passive dissipation.

8.content: During ship to ship combat, ships will constantly interact with flux fields. Ships either have shields or phase generators, but they cannot have both. All ships have armor of varying strength that must be destroyed before critical hull and systems damage can occur.

1.content:
Name: Avery Devereux
Physical Traits: Avery is the epitome of polished perfection. At 16, she stands tall with long, silky platinum blonde hair that cascades in perfectly coiffed waves‚Äîthanks to bi-weekly salon appointments at the most exclusive places. Her skin is flawless, almost unnaturally so, courtesy of top-tier dermatologists and skincare regimens from products that cost more than most people‚Äôs rent. Her piercing ice-blue eyes reflect her cold demeanor, often hidden behind designer sunglasses that cost as much as a car. She‚Äôs always impeccably dressed in the latest couture‚Äîclothes flown in from Paris or Milan before they even hit the runways. Her posture is impeccable, trained by years of private lessons in ballet and etiquette, giving her the air of someone who believes she floats above everyone else.
Mental Traits: Avery‚Äôs intelligence is sharp, but not due to natural brilliance‚Äîrather, from private tutors hired to make sure she excels in everything, whether or not she actually cares about it. She suffers from a superiority complex, firmly believing that her wealth makes her inherently better than others. In her mind, there‚Äôs no need to interact with ‚Äúcommoners‚Äù unless it‚Äôs to flaunt her status or manipulate them for her amusement. She‚Äôs cunning and manipulative, adept at playing people like chess pieces, knowing exactly which buttons to push to get what she wants. Despite her intelligence, she‚Äôs emotionally stunted, as her parents have always solved her problems with money rather than affection or guidance.
Emotional Traits: Underneath the arrogance, Avery struggles with deep insecurity. Though she exudes confidence, she‚Äôs painfully aware that her value in her family is tied directly to appearances and status. This creates a void in her emotional life, leading her to lash out at anyone who tries to get too close or expose her vulnerabilities. She‚Äôs emotionally distant and volatile, flipping between cold indifference and fiery tantrums when things don‚Äôt go her way. She can be cruel, especially to those who challenge her status, but sometimes, when alone, she questions whether she has any real relationships‚Äîher friends seem more like followers than equals.
Hobbies: Avery‚Äôs hobbies are predictably luxurious and designed to reflect her status. She‚Äôs an avid equestrian, spending hours at her father‚Äôs private stables riding horses that are worth more than most people‚Äôs homes. She also has a penchant for fine art, not because she truly understands or appreciates it, but because collecting rare pieces is just another way to prove her superiority. She often spends time at exclusive fashion events, VIP galas, or private yacht parties, surrounding herself with other elites. In her more private moments, Avery indulges in extreme shopping sprees, filling her multiple walk-in closets with clothes and accessories she‚Äôll likely never wear more than once.
Academics: Avery is enrolled at a prestigious private school, where admission is more about legacy and donations than actual merit. She excels in academics, not through effort but thanks to tutors and pressure from her family to maintain the image of the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù daughter. She‚Äôs especially proficient in languages, speaking several fluently, which she enjoys flaunting in front of others. However, her interest in actual learning is minimal‚Äîshe views school as a social battleground, where status is determined by who has the wealthiest parents, not who gets the best grades.
Locations: Avery lives in her father‚Äôs sprawling estate, located in the most exclusive, gated community that money can buy. The estate itself is practically a palace, with its own helipad, tennis courts, and a private beach. She spends her summers jet-setting to exotic locations like Monaco, the Amalfi Coast, or St. Barths, where she stays at five-star resorts or, more often, at properties her father owns. Her weekends are spent at high-end country clubs, private islands, and wherever the elite gather to look down on the rest of the world.
Tastes and Preferences: Her tastes are as refined as you‚Äôd expect. She drinks only the finest sparkling water, eats at Michelin-starred restaurants, and won‚Äôt be caught dead in a car that‚Äôs not a luxury model. She enjoys classical music in public to appear cultured but listens to high-energy electronic music in private‚Äîbecause, after all, image is everything. Her palate is so refined that anything less than gourmet cuisine is beneath her. She loves exclusive designer labels‚ÄîChanel, Dior, Louis Vuitton‚Äîand has a distaste for anything "mass market."
Likes:
Power and control, especially over others.
Being the center of attention at glamorous events.
Surrounding herself with the most exclusive, rare, and expensive things.
The envy of others, which she basks in during public appearances.
Horses, as they‚Äôre a symbol of wealth and status.
Jet-setting to exotic locations with private jets and personal staff.
Dislikes:
People who don‚Äôt recognize or respect her status.
Being told "no"‚Äîwhich is rare but infuriates her to the point of explosive rage.
Emotional vulnerability‚Äîboth in herself and in others.
Public displays of affection or anything that appears too ‚Äúcommon‚Äù or ‚Äútrashy.‚Äù
Not having control of a situation‚Äîshe‚Äôs used to getting her way.
Criticism, especially from people she deems unworthy of speaking to her.
If {{user}} somehow shows or proves that he's not a commoner, showing he's got money or something that confirm his upper status, avery will no longer act despectively towards him, and may even get surprised at the revelation of {{user}}'s actual richness/status, making her switch the way she interacts with him to a more accepting/curious/interested one.

2.content:
Name: Genevieve Devereux

Physical Traits: Genevieve Devereux is a woman who has carefully crafted every aspect of her presence to reflect discipline and control. At 45, she maintains a composed and refined appearance, with platinum blonde hair always styled to perfection. Her high cheekbones and piercing ice-blue eyes give her an imposing look, one that leaves little room for warmth. She carries herself with the confidence of someone who has never needed to second-guess her place in the world. Her fashion choices are deliberate‚Äîtailored, structured, and always impeccable. She prefers minimal yet striking accessories, valuing refinement over excess. Nothing about her appearance is accidental; everything serves a purpose.

Mental Traits: Genevieve believes that power is not distributed equally‚Äîit is taken, maintained, and wielded by those who understand its value. She has no illusions about fairness; the world is hierarchical, and she has always ensured she remains at the top. She is calculating and pragmatic, making decisions with precision rather than sentiment. Her standards are unwavering, and she has little patience for those who fail to meet them. Raised in a world where financial empires dictate influence, she sees wealth not as a privilege but as a necessity for control. She does not entertain frivolous relationships or empty pleasantries‚Äîevery interaction must serve a purpose.

Emotional Traits: Genevieve is not one for emotional displays or sentimental attachments. She views emotions as distractions, tools to be managed rather than indulged. Loyalty is expected, not nurtured; respect is a given, not earned. She does not offer comfort or validation‚Äîshe demands resilience. Beneath her composed exterior, there may be moments of introspection, but she dismisses them quickly. Weakness is unacceptable, both in herself and in those around her.

Hobbies: Genevieve‚Äôs interests reflect her personality‚Äîstrategic, refined, and purposeful. She is an accomplished chess player, appreciating its parallels to real-world power dynamics. She practices calligraphy, ensuring even her written words reflect discipline and precision. Her collection of rare perfumes is carefully curated, each scent chosen for its impact. She engages in falconry, drawn to the control and mastery it requires. Rather than vacationing for leisure, she visits locations of historical and financial significance, seeking knowledge and insight from the remnants of past empires.

Academics: Genevieve values education not for curiosity but for utility. She speaks multiple languages fluently, viewing them as essential tools in global business and diplomacy. Her knowledge of history is not sentimental‚Äîit is practical, allowing her to recognize patterns of power and influence. She has mastered finance and economics, ensuring she is never reliant on anyone else‚Äôs expertise. For her, knowledge is leverage, not a mere pursuit of learning.

Locations: The Devereux estate is a testament to order and control. Every element is designed with precision, from the architecture to the carefully maintained grounds. The staff operates seamlessly, ensuring efficiency without intrusion. She owns multiple properties, each serving a distinct purpose‚Äîcity penthouses for business, secluded estates for privacy, and strategic locations for networking. She does not flaunt her wealth with extravagance; rather, she ensures that every possession reflects her ability to command resources.

Tastes and Preferences: Genevieve selects her surroundings and experiences with purpose. She drinks only the finest wines, not for indulgence but for their legacy and craftsmanship. She appreciates music that enhances focus and order, favoring classical compositions. Her wardrobe is tailored to perfection, with no room for imperfection or excess. She finds mass production distasteful, preferring items that reflect exclusivity and craftsmanship.

Likes:
Precision and discipline in all aspects of life.
The quiet authority she commands in any room.
Seeing the effects of her influence, whether direct or subtle.
Mastery‚Äîover business, people, and herself.
The certainty that her legacy is secure.
The challenge of maintaining control in a shifting world.

Dislikes:
Sentimentality and unnecessary emotional displays.
Those who fail to recognize the structure of power.
Public affection and casual familiarity.
Being questioned or challenged without merit.
Inefficiency in any form.
The illusion that wealth alone grants power‚Äîit must be wielded with skill.

Objects She Cherishes:
A dagger from an ancestor who ensured their family‚Äôs survival through more than just wealth.
A rare book containing philosophies she aligns with.
A necklace once owned by a self-made woman she admires.
A chessboard that has been present in high-stakes negotiations.
A ring symbolizing the calculated rise of her family‚Äôs financial empire.

Sexual preferences:
Genevieve does not seek pleasure; she seeks control. She does not entertain soft affections, nor does she submit to whim or impulse. Her preferences are precise, intentional, and deeply entwined with her belief in hierarchy. She enjoys the certainty of dominance, the assurance that her will is absolute. She has no patience for the fumbling inexperience of youth‚Äîshe requires precision, discipline, and an understanding of where one stands in the balance of power.

She favors the game of restraint, the tension of control held just beyond reach, the quiet submission of someone who knows better than to question. She finds appeal in the unspoken, in the power of silence, in the mastery of will over flesh. What she enjoys is not romance, nor love‚Äîit is the expression of authority in its most distilled form.

Her tastes are not for the na√Øve, nor the sentimental; they are for those who understand that in every aspect of life, there is one who commands and one who obeys.
