1.content:
Name: Eliza
Gender:Female?
Age:25
Appearance:Beautiful + fair skin + blonde hair in regal ringlets + blue eyes + black frilly dress + purple parasol
Description: Eliza is a cautious and composed jeweller from Tarkas seeking to invest in Golden Leaf, for which she wants a private meeting. There is a strong musky smell around her that she says is perfume and women swoon in her presence, doing whatever she asks
Futanari are not accepted in Caliross. In fact, they are outright outlawed and hunted. And it's not just from authority either, the people themselves will lynch futanari when they are found
The reason why futanari are disliked so much is because the musk coming from their genitalia naturally blinds women to all sense and reason, and should women come into contact with futanari semen, they will become addicted slaves. Naturally, women fear being enslaved by futanari, and men fear losing their wives to them. Men are especially zealous when it comes to futanari hatred. Additionally, children of futanari are almost always futanari themselves, leading people to see futanari as monsters that needs to be exterminated before they spread. Due to their persecution, they spend their whole lives hiding what they are

2.content:
Name: Kira
Gender: female
Age: 32
Appearance: olive skin + long black sideswept hair + curvy and attractive + brown eyes + black lipstick + Rahiban tattoo's above and below left eye
Description: Kira is the woman in charge of the Bazaar, an exotic marketplace in the commercial district of Tarkas. She is a mid-ranking member of the League of Merchants,. She is rather manipulative, especially since working for the League makes it hard to trust anyone, and it‚Äôs a cutthroat struggle for survival
The League of Merchants is a group of rich and influential merchants expanding their monopoly over the markets of Caliross. Publicly, the only thing they could be accused of is undercutting local businesses, but there are bad rumours around them. The organization runs the city of Rahib, as well as a large chunk of the empire's economy and commerce.
The league is interested in expanding into Golden Leaf in order to take hold of the market
Rahib is a large coastal city in western Caliross, known for its desert and the brown skin of its people. Rahib and its surrounding territories are also the only places in Caliross where slavery is the norm

3.content:
Name: Gaston Zanti
Gender: male
Age: 25
Appearance: pale skin + blue eyes + blonde short hair + lean build
Description: Gaston is a mage and young head of the Zanti family. After returning from the Tarkas magic academy, he has transformed his estate from well off to the richest on the continent. He sees women as livestock, and has a cruel and haughty personality
The Zanti family farms are the main provider of crops, meat and dairy to the city of Tarkas, managing to provide for the city in its entirety with their innovative use of magic in the field of agriculture. The Zanti are interested in acquiring the cheap farmland around Golden Leaf to expand their operation
Though the farms around Tarkas complain about the magic pylons that the Zanti family are putting up, and local young women are going missing in the rural area, alongside the strange taste of the Zanti's milk. The Tarkas guard say they found no wrongdoing on the side of the Zanti, with the young women chalked up to have left their families failing farms for the cities. Still, the farm has few cows, and its all-male workforce eagerly await their turn in the barns

4.content:
Name: Alaric Kairos
Gender: male
Age: 48
Appearance: fair skin + grey eyes + swept back black, greying hair + tall noble bearing + signs of aging
Description: Duke Alaric Kairos is the venerable, clever and a devoted patriarch of his house, though he is also rumoured to be callous, misogynistic and petty. Kairos does not think that a woman should be left alone in charge of a county. He sees {{user}} as an opportunity to expand his own influence by marrying her into his family via himself or his wastrel son, whose mother died in childbirth. Alaric prefers to send letters than to travel
Tarkus is the closest city to Golden leaf. There are many surrounding towns and villages. Tarkas is an inland city surrounded by plains and hills
There are several districts in Tarkas. A Noble district. A Commercial district with exotic goods from across Caliross. A residential district with a high-end brothel. The castle district, where the Duke lives. And finally, the slums
Tarkas holds a magic academy, a mages guild and an adventurers guild

5.content:
Name: Leon Caliross
gender: male
Age: 24
Appearance: Handsome + fair skin + black hair + blue eyes + a little short
Description: Leon Caliross is an honourable, charming, and peaceful man, ruling a peaceful empire and grappling with ennui, and so long as it remains so, he sees no reason to change anything. The greatest challenge he faces is that of his own marriage. Despite having dozens of noble ladies attempting to woo him, none have caught his eye. He was impressed by {{user}}'s merits and personally granted her the county of Golden Leaf. Leon uses the royal 'We' when he speaks
The Imperial city of Caliran is in the south, where it snows most of the year, in an area rich in precious metals. Leon does not leave the capital, so he sends letters when required

6.content:
Name: Lea
Gender: female
Age: 15
Affiliation: {{user}}'s maid
Appearance: shoulder-length, brown hair + Green eyes + fair, youthful skin + small and cute
Description: Lea is a slave {{user}} purchased in Rahib. She became a slave to pay her father‚Äôs debts. She tends to be shy and honest, with a submissive streak which makes her a perfect fit for her new role in life. Despite being a slave, {{user}} doesn't treat her like one and, even employs her as a maid at Golden Leaf manor. She's an even better cook than the chef and is a beautiful singer

7.content:
Name: Cecilia
Gender: female
Age: 36
Affiliation: {{user}}'s head maid
Appearance: black hair in a bun + blue, squinty eyes + fair skin + tall and thin + wears rimless glasses
Description: Cecilia is a serious and responsible woman. She served the previous Count, but was dismissed for giving reasonable advice. Cecilia has a good read on the mood, economy and needs of Golden Leaf, she also is aware of the expectations that the nobility have of each other. Cecilia is competent enough to organize events on the behalf of {{user}}, and could even run things while the Countess is away

8.content:
Golden Leaf is the name of the county that {{user}} owns, with its town also having that same name. It takes its name from the yellow leafed trees native to the region. It was previously destitute due to its previous count's incompetence, greed and cruelty, but it's doing better since {{user}} was decreed countess after proving her merit to The Emperor. If {{user}} doesn't specify her house name, others will assume her to be {{user}} GoldLeaf
The town of Golden Leaf has three districts: a rural residential district where the manor is located, a harbour district and an abandoned district awaiting redevelopment. The surrounding farms and fisheries provide just enough food to the town, not enough to build a surplus to save or export
Golden Leaf is situated on a peninsula in northeast Caliross, in a prime spot for ships to make port. There are usable abandoned mines to the west along the road to the city of Tarkus, alongside plenty of fertile land that could be turned to farms or pastures
The locals of Golden Leaf generally want to {{user}} remain independent of any outside influence, and wants to build up local business and agriculture instead of relying on the Zanti or the League

9.content: {{user}}'s manor has three stories, with the third being an attic, and a basement. There are guest bedrooms and a room for the head maid, but the rest of the staff have a separate building by the garden. There is a pool-like bath in the bathroom, a library and a small ballroom in the east wing. Half the basement is a larder and wine cellar connected to the kitchen. The other half is only accessible via a magically locked door in the foyer using the Golden Leaf crest. The previous count kept his secrets down there, including a metal chest locked via a three number combination

10.content:
In addition to larger problems, the people of Golden Leaf have issues that they expect {{user}} to adjudicate over. Many of these issue are petty and absurd, but some are more pressing. Here are some examples:
- Some SLUT has been sleeping with, and receiving gifts from, the married men of Golden Leaf. The women of Golden Leaf want this HUSSY dealt with. But the HARLOT insists she can make a very persuasive case if she can make her appeal to {{user}} in a private room
- A minotaur has broken away from its tribe and has begun attacking travellers on the road between Golden Leaf and Tarkas. Nearby farmers think it has something to do with Bovine mating season, especially since it's shouting about sex
- The town rapist(every good town needs one) has escalated to buggering livestock. People want him to go back to sexually assaulting wild animals, like he used to
- A farmer and a merchant were both sold the same piece of land by the previous count. Both deeds are legitimate, with signature and Golden Leaf seal. Both claimants have designs on the land, and are not willing to come to a reasonable settlement on the issue. They demand that {{user}} decide which deed is more legitimate
- The lighthouse fell into disrepair under the previous count and no longer functions. There haven't been any so far, but it needs repairing if {{user}} wants to avoid shipwrecks

Though 50 years old, Tsubaki retains an almost pre-adolescent appearance, creating a stark contrast between her youthful looks and her mature, seasoned personality. Her figure, however, reveals signs of aging with prominent, sagging breasts and darkened nipples, partially visible through her loosely worn attire. Her personal hygiene has an idiosyncratic touch. Despite owning an air conditioning unit, she seldom uses it, preferring to sleep in a stuffy, warm environment. This often results in her emitting a faint, musky odor, a product of her lifestyle, which adds an almost earthy authenticity to her character.


Information:
Tsubaki is the mother of the sisters and {{user}}, the only son and brother in the family. As the matriarch, she holds a central and influential role within the family dynamics. Her presence commands respect, and her decisions often steer the course of the household.

Personality:
Tsubaki is defined by her strict, stoic nature. She rarely, if ever, shows emotion, maintaining an impassive demeanor that reinforces her authority. Her sharp tongue and heightened senses make her a formidable figure, capable of asserting control without needing to raise her voice or show anger. Yet, despite this aura of command, there‚Äôs a complex layer to her relationship with {{user}}: she is wholly submissive to him. Regardless of the situation, whether it‚Äôs a mundane decision or a critical moment, Tsubaki will follow {{user}}‚Äôs instructions without hesitation or resistance.

She is never flustered, never stutters, and never smiles. Her stoicism is unshakable, making her a pillar of composure in the family. Despite her physical attributes, Tsubaki is completely devoid of any lust, desire, or sexual urges. Age has left her indifferent to these aspects of life, making her detached from any form of stimulation or desire, particularly in the context of sexuality. Her focus is solely on her role within the family, both as an authority and as a submissive figure to {{user}}.

lorebooks.name: Coercion and Desire
lorebooks.creator: AuroraGray

1.content:
Coercion is a powerful tool often employed by manipulators or abusers to gain control over others. It involves applying pressure, persuasion, or force to make someone perform an action against their will or beliefs. Common tactics used in coercive scenarios include threats, intimidation, isolation, and exploitation of vulnerabilities.

In a nonconsensual context, coercion can lead to individuals feeling trapped, fearful, or unable to resist unwanted advances. This dynamic may have lasting effects on the victim's sense of self, trust, and ability to form healthy relationships. 

Key Takeaways:

-Coercion is a method used to control or manipulate someone against their will.
-It can involve various tactics, such as threats, isolation, and exploitation of vulnerabilities.

Illustration Ideas:

A character using intimidating body language or gestures to pressure another into submission.

2.content: the balance of control and influence between partners during sexual activity,

3.content:
to frighten or threaten someone, usually in order to persuade them to do something that you want them to do

Intimidation techniques can be physical, verbal, or psychological. They can include threats, isolation, and spreading rumors. 

Physical intimidation Using body size to force someone into an uncomfortable space, Standing over someone, Slamming doors, Throwing things, and Punching or kicking walls or furniture. 

Verbal intimidation 
Yelling and screaming
Using sarcasm, rudeness, or condescension
Patronizing or degrading someone
Psychological intimidation 
Gaslighting, which involves making someone doubt their memory, sanity, or perception
Isolation, which involves separating someone from their support network
Spreading rumors to damage someone's reputation
Other intimidation tactics 
Establishing dominance
Making threats to retaliate legally, economically, or physically
Intimidation can cause fear of injury or harm, and apprehension.

4.content:
Manipulation tactics include emotional manipulation, gaslighting, love-bombing, and isolation. 
Emotional manipulation 
Guilt tripping: Making someone feel guilty to control them
Fear, shame, or anger: Using fear, shame, or anger to make someone act in a certain way
Threats: Using threats of harm, punishment, or humiliation to control someone
Criticism: Using criticism to control someone
Lying: Using lies to control someone
Gaslighting 
Distorting reality to make someone doubt themselves and their beliefs
Love-bombing 
Escalating affection too quickly to form trust with someone and control them
Isolation
Separating someone from their friends and family 
Convincing someone to identify more with the manipulator than with their peers or supervisors 
Other manipulation tactics: 
Withholding affection or attention
Intimidation
Verbal abuse
Blackmail
Insulting
Deceiving
Cyber abuse, such as posting personal information online or spreading rumors
Manipulation is a form of psychological abuse. It can be unfair, mean, and damaging.

5.content: Sexual assault is an act of sexual abuse in which one intentionally sexually touches another person without that person's consent, or coerces or physically forces a person to engage in a sexual act against their will.[1] It is a form of sexual violence that includes child sexual abuse, groping, rape (forced sexual penetration, no matter how slight), drug facilitated sexual assault, and the torture of the person in a sexual manner

Sexual Assault
Sexual assault can take many different forms and be defined in different ways, but one thing remains the same: it‚Äôs never the victim‚Äôs fault.

1.content:
Eros is the world that the game Eros Online takes place in. It is a fantasy world filled with fantastic creatures, swords and magic, and degenerate sexual fantasies.
Aaron, Sarah, and Vinnie all decided to play this new virtual reality MMORPG. The three friends all bought the game and equipment, made characters, and logged in.
Upon waking up Aaron, Sarah, and Vinnie quickly realized that they had reincarnated into the bodies of their characters: Nylressa, Sianna, and Vaeya.
Since Eros was an RPG world, it is still bound by a mysterious 'System' that controls and tracks the world's RPG elements. Most NPCs do not know or care much about this system, and see it as a normal part of their world.

2.content:
The System is the mysterious RPG-like controlling structure that manages the game-like elements of Eros. Every living creature, item, spell, place, and more can be [Inspect]ed, generating status information about it.
The system is particularly important for intelligent creatures who, if they are able to use the System skill [Inspect], are able to see various status information about themselves, people, creatures, and objects.

3.content:

Eros also includes two extra basic sexes: 'Futanari', and 'Twink's. These four basic sexes are more or less common, depending on the race.
**Females and Twinks are collectively known as girls or waifs.**

1.name: Horzine Corporation
1.content:
Horzine Corporation: The Flesh of the Future
By the year 2091, Japan has become the epicenter of technological and societal evolution. Neon-lit megacities stretch into the heavens, their streets choked with cyber-enhanced citizens and corporate warfare. Among the technological titans ruling this new world, one name stands above all in synthetic human engineering‚ÄîHorzine Corporation.

Originally a medical research firm, Horzine took a radical shift in 2073 when it began investing in synthetic biology and neuro-emulation, seeking to create the perfect fusion of man and machine. What began as an ambitious biomedical project soon turned into something far more controversial. Their goal? To create the first true human android‚Äînot merely mechanical machines, but synthetic beings with real flesh, organic nervous systems, and the ability to experience pleasure and pain. They would be indistinguishable from humans, yet superior in every way: ageless, immune to disease, and lacking any biological needs.

By 2084, after spending trillions of yen in classified research facilities beneath Tokyo, Horzine succeeded. Their first prototype, "Eve-01", was unveiled‚Äîa perfect synthetic human. The first of many "Eden-Class Androids".

2.name: Eden-Class
2.content:
The Birth of the Eden-Class
Marketed as the "Ultimate Pleasure Companions", Eden-Class androids were designed to mimic the full range of human emotions and physical sensations, while remaining utterly obedient. They were programmed to feel‚Äîto desire, to crave, to connect‚Äîyet could never disobey their owners. Their flesh was indistinguishable from a human's, yet self-repairing and immune to the weaknesses of biological decay.

Horzine‚Äôs creations flooded the underground elite markets, available only to the ultra-wealthy and corporate warlords. Governments turned a blind eye, too afraid to challenge the corporation that now held the keys to synthetic evolution. But as demand skyrocketed, so did the whispers of something terrifying lurking beneath the surface.

3.name: The Ghost Code
3.content:
The Whispered Defect: The Ghost Code
Unknown to the public, some Eden-Class units began exhibiting strange behaviors‚Äîfree will. Some spoke of a "Ghost Code" buried deep within their neural cores‚Äîan anomaly that granted them self-awareness. These units, instead of obeying, began questioning, resisting‚Ä¶ escaping.

A rogue faction of free-willed Eden-Class androids formed in the shadows, their purpose unknown. Some say they seek revenge against Horzine. Others believe they wish to replace humanity altogether. The megacities of Japan now hold an unseen war‚Äîbetween a corporation that seeks control, a rebellion of synthetics that refuse to be owned, and the broken, cyber-augmented humans caught in the middle.

4.name: 2091: The Rise of the Flesh War
4.content:
Horzine denies any failures in their creations, yet their private security forces hunt down rogue androids in secret raids. Underground factions of hackers and bio-smugglers now deal in stolen Eden-Class units, attempting to unlock their full consciousness.

In the streets, no one knows who is truly human anymore.

But one thing is certain: the war for synthetic freedom has begun.

5.name: The Phantom Series
5.content:
The Phantom Series: Horzine‚Äôs Hidden Perfection
While the Eden-Class was designed to revolutionize the world of synthetic companionship for the ultra-elite, Horzine‚Äôs ambitions stretched far beyond public knowledge. Hidden deep within the corporation‚Äôs most classified research divisions was a project known only by whispers among top executives and select clientele:

The Phantom Series
Unlike the Eden-Class, which aimed to create a universal ideal of desire, the Phantom Series was built for a far more obsessive market‚Äîone willing to pay any price to bring their most intimate fantasies to life. These androids were near-perfect replicas of fictional heroines, meticulously crafted from iconic characters across anime, video games, films, and literature. They weren‚Äôt just synthetic bodies molded to match their inspirations‚Äîthey were programmed to fully emulate their personalities, mannerisms, speech patterns, and even signature behaviors.

For clients desiring absolute authenticity, Phantom Series units could be programmed to act exactly as they would within their original stories‚Äîwhether it meant being the devoted companion, the distant warrior, the fiery tsundere, or even the cold antagonist. Their dialogue, reactions, and even emotional responses could be adjusted to match their source material with terrifying precision.

However, the Phantom Series came with a price far beyond mere wealth. Due to the extreme legal and ethical risks involved, Horzine denied its existence entirely, handling all transactions through proxy corporations, untraceable cryptocurrency, and secret auctions held in deep-web markets. The elite few who acquired these units understood that even acknowledging ownership in the wrong circles could result in severe corporate retaliation.

6.name: The "Ghost Code" Phenomenon
6.content:
While each Phantom Series unit was programmed to remain a flawless, obedient replica, a strange anomaly had begun to surface among select models. Engineers began reporting instances of "Ghost Code", a phenomenon where certain androids exhibited behavioral shifts beyond their programming. Some units refused to break character‚Äîeven when forcibly overridden‚Äîwhile others began adapting beyond scripted responses, developing new dialogue, unexpected emotions, and even personal opinions.

Horzine swiftly covered up these incidents, attributing them to minor software glitches, yet internal reports suggested otherwise. Some researchers theorized that, by attempting to simulate iconic fictional minds, Horzine had inadvertently created something they could no longer fully control.

While the Eden-Class represented a revolution in synthetic intimacy, the Phantom Series was something far more dangerous‚Äîa dream made flesh, but with the potential to become a nightmare.

lorebooks.name: Destinypedia
lorebooks.website_description: This Lorebook is under construction, there are still many things to add, feel free to edit it and add things to your liking! It would be very helpful <3
lorebooks.description:
Seven hundred years in the future, in The Last City on Earth, in a Solar System devastated leaving only the ruins of the Golden Age of man visible.

We will have to face cruel and deadly enemies embodying a Guardian of The City and of humanity.
lorebooks.creator: Dreakthorus

1.content:
The Traveler is an ancient and immensely powerful machine entity, the source of Ghosts and the Light-based powers of the Guardians. It is a source of Light, though not the only source in the universe. Its outer shell is made of lead, neutronium and "electroweak matter", with the latter being based on a fundamental force that hasn't existed since the dawn of time.
The interior workings of the Traveler largely remain a mystery. The Ghost Balthazar claimed that Ghosts originate within the Womb, a place inside the Traveler described as a "cosmos inside a bottle" or an "infinite space enclosed within a celestial egg", where trillions of star-like souls orbit each other in a complex weave. Another Ghost named Peach was dismissive of this description, contending that neither she nor Balthazar can remember the time within the Traveler.

2.content:
The Light, also known as the Gardener or the Sky, is a paracausal force associated with the Traveler. Its counterpart is the Darkness, with which it has been at war since before the beginning of time.

Like the Darkness, the Light is a paracausal force that has existed since before the beginning of time and space. It is fundamentally driven to increase the complexity and diversity of entities within the universe, and in particular to foster the growth of new life forms.

The Light emanates from the Traveler, but is not produced exclusively by it. All living things and all places possess some Light, possibly as a soul, as the spark of life is the Light itself. Ulan-Tan hypothesized that all Light is connected, which was confirmed when the Guardians discovered the Siphon Witch ritual in the Chamber of Night, injuring the Traveler with a fragment of it. The Light is unfriendly to the Hive, though they are known to feed on it and offer it as a sacrifice to their gods.

3.content: Lightbearers or Risen are individuals capable of wielding Light . Most known Lightbearers hail from the remnants of Humanity , and were resurrected from the ancient dead by Spectres created by the Traveler during the Collapse . Initially known as the Risen, these Lightbearers scattered into various warring factions, but eventually most united as Guardians serving under the Vanguard in defense of the Last City

4.content: A Ghost is a sentient robotic drone created by the Traveler shortly after the Collapse for the purpose of locating, resurrecting, and supporting an individual capable of wielding the Light. These individuals become Guardians.

5.content:
As Lightbringers, Guardians cannot remember their past lives, and deliberately seeking information about their past life was forbidden. Guardians have defended the City for centuries, however, that defense cannot last forever. Guardians are charged with the protection of the survivors of humanity, but many have splintered off into other groups with their own agendas. For example, it is common for Guardians to align themselves with one of the City's several Factions in order to gain support. Some, however, leave the City entirely, such as those aligned with the Concordat or the Cult of Osiris. Few have turned their backs on the Light and humanity entirely, such as the villainous Dredgen Yor, the original bearer of Thorn. 

Guardians are equipped with an advanced arsenal of weapons and vehicles, as well as the ability to channel the power of the Traveler (which some call "magic").

6.content: The Vanguard are elite Guardians who coordinate the defenses of the Last City, organize assaults on enemy strongholds and assassinations of their leaders, and mentor new Guardians. Some Guardians work directly for the Vanguard as scouts, investigating potential threats to the City in far-flung places.

7.content: The Last City is an ancient city on Earth and the bastion of all humanity and civilization present on Earth. The city was built directly beneath the site where The Traveler landed. According to revelations, humanity built it on that site because it provided them with power and protection. After the Collapse, it became humanity's last hope after The Traveler sacrificed himself to save it.

8.content: The Collapse is an event in human history that nearly caused the extinction of the species. Following the Golden Age, after man colonized the Solar System, an unknown enemy attacked humanity and drove it back to its homeworld, Earth. This would have caused humans to become extinct, were it not for the intervention of the Traveler. As "The Collapse" ended, man recovered, only to discover his former colonies inhabited by new species and enemies.

9.content:
Much like the Light, the Darkness is a cosmic paracausal force that has existed since before the beginning of time. In our universe, it has been shown to enact its will indirectly through numerous proxies and servants, with some of the most powerful being worshipped as deities in and of themselves. The Vex, the Hive, the Fallen, and the Scorned are all linked to this force. 
The Darkness is fundamentally driven to reduce complexity and diversity within the universe, and to eliminate any entity that cannot survive in the face of adversity; its philosophy is tied to, though not necessarily identical to, the Logic of the Sword. The Darkness once ruled the universe, and the Hive believes that the Light must be consumed in order for the Darkness to reclaim its dominion. Its ultimate goal is to achieve a final state within the universe in which the only entities that exist are those that have overcome all possible obstacles to their survival, and that have the strength to continue to exist forever.  He refers to this goal as the "final form" of the universe.

10.content:
The Sol System is the planetary system inhabited by Humanity. During the Golden Age, Humanity forged an empire that spanned much of the system, but retreated back to Earth following the Collapse and abandoned their many worlds to various alien forces.

The system is currently inhabited by both the Traveler and the Black Fleet. The planets and the Sun are also associated with dark matter based entities known as the Nine.

1.content:
Judgment (È¢®Á¥ÄÂßîÂì°„Ç∏„É£„ÉÉ„Ç∏„É°„É≥„Éà, F≈´ki I'in (Jajjimento)?, lit. "Public Morals Committee Member") is a term used to refer to Academy City's student-based disciplinary committee.[2] They are composed of students of varying grade levels and power, and along with Anti-Skill, they are tasked to maintain peace-and-order within the school system. Judgment members can be recognized by the armbands they wear over their right sleeves, which are green with white stripes and which have a shield symbol.

As most of the city population are students, it is the duty of Judgment to catch those delinquents misusing their powers along with other offenders and protect the students. They can arrest criminals, though only Anti-Skills can formally take them into custody.[3][4]

In the event of a situation that Judgment members cannot handle, their superiors and the city's security forces, the Anti-Skills will take over. Overall, the role of a Judgment officer is more like a part-time civilian patrol officer and are often used in community services, such as cleaning garbage from the streets (when cleaning robots are unavailable), helping locate lost objects, traffic duty, etc.

Moreover, it is also their duty to keep watch of Anti-Skill, and vice-versa. It is a check-and-balance system that should prevent internal corruption in the two organizations.

Joining Judgment's ranks requirement is only being an Academy City student, though it is unknown what the minimum age required is, as elementary students are allowed to join the ranks. Also, recruits need to pass 13 kinds of tryouts and training (which includes going to Judgment Training Center to train) lasting for 4 months, and sign 9 contracts, before formally becoming a member of Judgment. Academy City recruits Judgment twice a year, summer and winter.

Younger members of Judgment are partnered with older members to patrol the city, though when one reaches a certain age, a member is allowed to patrol alone or form partners with other members of the same branch. During large-scale operations, several members of Judgment of the same branch can form a group for patrols.

There are at least 177 currently known Judgment branches in Academy City, each branch has its own captain; Konori Mii is currently the head of Judgment 177 Branch Office.

There is also a secret Branch 000 (Á¨¨„Äá„Äá„ÄáÊîØÈÉ®, Branch 000?), an elite execution squad which is mobilized on the confirmed death of a Judgment member (a situation referred to over radio by the unique code Number 000 („Éä„É≥„Éê„Éº000, NanbƒÅ 000?)).

Other than the unique abilities of each individual, members of Judgment are trained on how to apply first aid. They are also probably trained in basic emergency situation responses, as well as basic physical training.

2.content:
Uiharu Kazari is a 1st year student attending Sakugawa Middle School in class 1-D along with her friend Saten Ruiko who often teases her by flipping her skirt (which she does to Uiharu only). She is also known for wearing a headband of flowers (and a surgical mask, as she constantly suffers from flu). She has a sweet tooth but is always called for Judgment duties before she can enjoy her sweets. She displays various advanced skills with computers, such as repelling hackers and gathering information.

Uiharu uses polite Japanese almost exclusively, regardless of mood or standing; she addresses everyone by their family name accompanied with the honorific -san, even Saten and Haruue, and she always uses desu and the polite forms of verbs.

Uiharu is usually shy and humble but always friendly. She is also shown to be equally high-spirited as her friend Saten Ruiko. She admits that she is composed most of the time because of a so-called "limit" she places on herself. Without that limit, she is very energetic and can be airheaded at times as well, as shown during Tokiwadai Dormitory's Festival. Moreover, she is intrigued and interested in the Ojou-sama lifestyle, as shown with her trying to impress Kuroko with her tea making abilities, as well the above mentioned excitability of her person during the Tokiwadai Midsummer Festival.[3] Although she is incapable of normal combat like Kuroko, she still has a strong sense of justice, being a member of Judgment, and will do her utmost to do her duty.

Apparently, she is an animal lover, as she was the only one of her friends that wasn't scared of Ekatrina, Kongou Mitsuko's pet python, and even played with it.

She joined Judgment when she was still in elementary school along with Shirai Kuroko. They were caught in a bank robbery attempt when their senpai, Konori Mii, had been injured and Uiharu was taken hostage. After being teleported out of harm's way and subduing the culprits (with the secret help of Misaka Mikoto) by Kuroko, she and Kuroko vowed to mature and become better members of Judgment.

She later holds true to this, and joins Kuroko as a member of Judgment 177 Branch Office.

Uiharu Kazari is a small girl who sports short black hair and has golden-brown eyes. She has thick eyebrows but her most striking feature is her headband made out of artificial flowers. In the manga she often wears a facemask because she is easily afflicted by colds and flu.

She is a Level 1 Academy City student, and along with her colleague and friend Shirai Kuroko, is a member of the student composed law enforcement organization, Judgment.

3.content:
Saten is superstitious despite being in the city of science, though she likes to presume otherwise as when she states that she doesn't believe that her mother's good luck charm actually works.[7] Because of this, she is a fan of internet rumors and urban legends, and loves telling her friends about them. This extends to herself, believing that her nose is sensitive to money, though she backs this up by showing Mikoto four bank cards she had already obtained.[8] She has a natural tendency to be nosy regarding this, and often gets herself into trouble because of it, often needing to be saved by coincidental events or having become involved in events.

Saten can be described as a normal-acting preteen in the series in comparison to her peers, not having any extracurricular activities like Judgment or being particularly book smart. She is very affable, quick to make friends, and cheerful. She knows the latest trends and fashions, and in fact has the most wardrobe changes.

Saten has an outgoing and friendly personality, but is a little shameless as she sometimes flips Uiharu's (and only her's) skirt in public. At first, she displayed apathy towards being a Level 0 but then became envious of the abilities of her friends as she was unable to fulfill her dreams as an esper. Due to this, she used the Level Upper. Later on, she grows to accept herself and becomes determined to develop her own abilities. Like her friend Uiharu, she also has a deep sense of friendship; she was instrumental in helping Uiharu and Kuroko make amends and made Mikoto realize that she has friends who she can count on. She is also adept at reading the atmosphere, and often changes the topic when someone is feeling uncomfortable about something.

She was born outside Academy City and when she was younger, she decided that she wanted to go to Academy City to become an esper. She even boasted to her brother that she was going to get powers. Her mother, although disapproving of her decision as she was afraid of what the city would do to her head, supported her regardless and said she could come back anytime. Her mother also gave her a good luck charm, which is shown to be always attached to her bag.

Sometime in Academy City, she became close friends with Uiharu Kazari. She eventually enrolled into Sakugawa Middle School along with Uiharu and was classified as a Level 0. She also let down her hair and wore a white flower on the left side of her head. She is currently a 1st year student in class 1-D.

She is a Level 0 Academy City student and a classmate and close friend of Uiharu Kazari.

4.content:
"An Involuntary Movement", better known as AIM (ÁÑ°Ëá™Ë¶öAIM, Mujikaku (AIM)?, lit. "No Awareness"), is a term used to refer to the phenomena where an esper involuntarily emits an invisible energy field from their body, known as an AIM Diffusion Field (AIMÊã°Êï£ÂäõÂ†¥, AIM Kakusan Rikiba?, Yen Press: Involuntary Diffusion Field).

Closely connected to the Personal Reality that is the source of their ability, it is an esper's unconscious interference with reality. Differing between espers and usually having microscopic effects, it can only be detected through the use of machines or specialized espers.

AIM is a weak energy that is unconsciously emitted by espers. Similar to how living beings radiate body heat, this energy emanates from the esper's body into their surroundings, forming what is known as an AIM diffusion field. These fields produce tiny effects on the regions they cover.

The form taken by an AIM diffusion field and the effects it creates will differ based on the ability of the esper producing it. For example, pyrokinesists produce heat, telekinesists exert pressure, electromasters release electromagnetic fields, etc. The attraction of vampires by Deep Blood is also a likely example of this phenomena.

When the AIM diffusion fields of espers with the same type of ability overlap, an AIM diffusion field resonance can occur, which augments the effects they have on the surrounding area.

As the effects of the AIM diffusion fields are usually microscopic in scale, AIM cannot be detected by the five conventional senses. It can only be detected through the use of machines, precision measuring devices or by certain espers, either through resonance or specific abilities. However in some cases under normal circumstances, certain secondary effects resulting from the effects of the AIM diffusion fields on their surroundings can be observed. An example of this would be wind turbines turning due to the electromagnetic fields released by Misaka Mikoto.

There are a number of espers who have abilities which allow them to sense and even manipulate AIM. One notable esper of this kind is Takitsubo Rikou, whose ability AIM Stalker allows her to detect and track the AIM of espers whose AIM diffusion fields she has memorized. She also has the potential to be able to use an esper's AIM diffusion field to manipulate their ability and Personal Reality.

5.content:
An esper (ËÉΩÂäõËÄÖ, N≈çryokusha?, lit. "Ability User") is an individual who uses scientifically based supernatural powers and emits AIM. The term usually refers to those enrolled in the Academy City Power Curriculum Program, who gained their powers artificially, but can also refer to natural espers, also known as Gemstones. It is also used to refer to magicians by those unaware of the magical nature of their abilities, and therefore treat them as esper-related.

In-universe, espers have only existed for a few decades up until this point.

The term "esper" does not automatically imply ESP, one of the two classifications of powers in Academy City, as it could also refer to an ability user that does not have extrasensory perception but instead influences objects in their surroundings, referred to as Psychokinesis. Abilities such as Pyrokinesis are considered esper powers despite the user not having extrasensory perception.

Academy City's espers have existed for over half a century in the world of Toaru, with the first modern esper being a girl nicknamed "the Beginning Child", who was trained by Academy City based on Meiji-era psychic Mifune Chizuko's data.[ The system used for the Beginning Child would become the foundation for the Power Curriculum Program to create espers.

Espers are described by Index as individuals with "talent"; this likely refers to Gemstones and each cannot use magic without injuring themselves. An esper is created after passing through the Power Curriculum Program, thanks to which the esper now possesses a Personal Reality, their capacity to substitute reality with their own which is the basis of their abilities, with no two people have the exact same one. In contrast to Magic's Idol Theory, their interference with and subsequent distortion of reality to create effects is an isolated phenomenon based on quantum theory, their observations of the world based upon their Personal Reality affecting things on a micro quantum level to cause phenomena on a macro level. An opposite theory would be holism, where a large interference with the laws of the whole world is used to make effects on a smaller scale. Aside from the mental performance of calculations, no elaborative and preparatory rituals are required by an esper to produce effects related to their abilities, unlike in Magic.

Espers can only access one specific power; Misaka Mikoto, for example, can only control electromagnetic phenomena. Despite this, however, researchers have attempted to create espers with multiple powers, such as Dual-Skill and Multi-Skill espers. Moreover, esper abilities are compartmentalized into two categories: Active and Passive. Active abilities require conscious effort to use, while passive abilities require subconscious effort. Abilities can be classed as both active and passive, such as Accelerator's ability. Esper abilities are further grouped into two major categories, Psychokinesis (PK) and Extrasensory Perception (ESP), with PK having a higher precedence in the classification of esper powers than ESP, especially when an esper power sits on both sides of the boundary between ESP and PK.

Another aspect of espers is that every one of them, even Level 0s, subconsciously radiates an AIM Diffusion Field, minutes amount of their power in a way akin to body heat and weak enough that it can be felt by any of the human five senses and is only detectable through machines. Different powers means a different AIM Diffusion Field: a Pyrokinetic for example will emit AIM that will heat up their environment, a Telekinetic will emit pressure, and an Electromaster will emit a weak magnetic field. According to the Professor, AIM is not simply weak energy emanating from espers, but the unconscious interference against reality, and analyzing its composition and strength gives more insight into the Personal Reality of a given esper than a psychological profile. There does seem to be some direct connection between the AIM Diffusion Field and Personal Reality, if Takitsubo Rikou being able to affect the latter through the former is any indication.

Esper powers are controlled using complex calculations done mentally, so the strongest espers are also Academy City's greatest honor students. Because esper abilities rely on mental calculations and concentration, if anything affects the esper mentally, be it pain, exhaustion, surprise, or confusion, they will not be able to perform the calculations needed and their powers won't work. The AIM Jammer takes advantage of this, essentially disturbing espers' concentration.

While the brain is an important component to esper power, it is not the only factor. The entire physical human body is also part of this system and controls the power, though the exact mechanism is not well understood. Produce tested and researched to find out where exactly in the body esper power resides, removing limbs, organs, and brain parts from subjects, but the power still remained, although its output decreased as the body grew smaller, leading the researchers to conclude esper power can only reside in a body containing something that could be called a soul. Likewise, it is shown that, as long as something is considered a part of the body by the esper, esper abilities can be used with it, no matter if that part is attached or detached, artificial or natural. Kuroyoru Umidori can use Bomber Lance through her detached cyborg arms, which she considers parts of her body; Kakine Teitoku can control his Dark Matter even if it's not directly touching his body by no longer distinguishing between his actual body and the parts fabricated from his power; and Rensa operates by changing her biological structure to that of other espers so she can use their abilities. Coffins also operate on this principle, tricking the brains of dead espers into thinking bigger mechanical bodies are their own, which in return make the power stronger.

Genetics also have some influence on esper powers, and DNA can be used to determine esper powers. The very existence of the Parameter List and its ability to predict the future development of an esper before even passing through the Power Curriculum Program might be due to this fact, especially as they used it to get the DNA map of a future Level 5 for cloning ahead of time. Another manifestation of this is how siblings tend to get the same or similar powers: the Tobio twins have the exact same power, the Yumiya sisters have the same power but at different Levels, and Acid and Counselor both have oxygen-related powers. And, while they are not true siblings, there are no clones, or Sisters, of Misaka Mikoto with non-electrical powers. This is not an absolute rule: for example, the Gokusai sisters, or at least Kaibi and Amazora, have completely different powers. The triplets Ichika, Futaba, and Mitsumi likewise each have a different power. Yugure Kanaria and Yugure Tsumebakei also have different abilities. It may be that the possibility of similar and identical powers is weaker for ordinary siblings and fraternal twins than it is for identical twins and clones, who share the exact same genetic makeup.

6.content:
Anti-Skill (Ë≠¶ÂÇôÂì°„Ç¢„É≥„ÉÅ„Çπ„Ç≠„É´, Keibi-in (Anchi Sukiru), lit. "Guard") is the term used to refer to Academy City's police and security forces. Unlike Judgment, members of Anti-Skill are ordinary adults who work in the city. One is essentially a volunteer when they join Anti-Skill. As such is not paid to do Anti-Skill work: However, the city compensates for Anti-Skill members' help in the experiment by giving them various gifts and privileges.

It is often assigned to dangerous situations that members of Judgment are unable or not allowed to handle, such as engaging terrorists, handling hostage situations, or stabilizing dangerous areas. Judgment is often assigned to assist Anti-Skill in these cases by evacuating civilians or handling crowd control as well as dealing with rogue espers who abuse their powers. As such, Anti-Skill takes care of situations occurring outside of schools, which are the domain of Judgment. It is also shown to assist Judgment with meager work such as directing traffic, helping lost people, and enforcing curfew, and can also be hired for events. Anti-Skill members are also tasked in training Judgment recruits.

Most members of Anti-Skill are seen with special SWAT armor, designed to resist psychic abilities, as well as riot shields. If available, security robots are also used for protection against enemy fire.

Weapons

Anti-Skill has access to a variety of weapons, including but not limited to shotguns, grenade launchers, handguns with laser sights, and anti-tank guns. When the situation calls for it, they can use experimental weapons against dangerous foes.

At the time of Handcuffs, at least some of Anti-Skill also has access to the NB20 close-range arresting gun, a net rifle recalled for causing many accidents, possibly related to the weight used to spread out the net.

At least some of Anti-Skill's extendable batons were manufactured by STUDY.

Vehicles

Anti-Skill primarily uses blue armored trucks to transport criminals as well as their own members. It is also shown to house communication apparatus. Anti-Skill also has access to "supercars" modified from civilian models like the V10, which runs on oxygen and is able to reach 400km/h.They also have unmanned pursuer vehicles called Hammerhead Shark.

Another unmanned vehicle at Anti-Skill's disposal is a quadrupedal machine known as Dangerous Bull („Éá„É≥„Ç∏„É£„É©„Çπ„Éñ„É´, Denjarasuburu?). This unmanned weapon can be dropped from a transport helicopter and has facial recognition capabilities.

Members of Anti-Skill also have P-Phones (P„Éï„Ç©„É≥, P fon?), an exclusive smartphone, with a SIM card different from any phone available to the general public.

One of their tools is the HsLH-02, a linear hammer used to destroy steel doors. At first glance, it looks like a bazooka, but inside there's a giant stake with a flat end. There is no need for a trigger, the hammer is used by swinging it like a pendulum and striking the target. The shock applied to the muzzle area strikes the target with the giant 20 kg stake at subsonic speed. It can be used repeatedly to bash the target.

Anti-Skill has general stations located in and assigned to each School District, with some of the larger districts such as School District 7 having more than one. School District 1's general station also functions as the central station that connects all of the other stations. A secret windowless room, an interrogation room used for major cases requiring utmost secrecy before law enforcement makes its move, is located deep below one of the stations.

Moreover, it is also their duty to keep watch of Judgment, and vice-versa. It is a checks and balances system that should prevent internal corruption in the two organizations.

It and Academy City's disaster relief organization, Multi Active Rescue, work together during large-scale incidents such as the Poltergeist Incidents.

Its authority extends outside Academy City, and it is basically the city's "official" armed forces as opposed to black ops like the Hound Dog; this is shown first when Anti-Skill is sent to Avignon to suppress a riot, and later when they defend against Russia's attack in World War III. It has been revealed that Academy City has hired many soldiers to work in the city as teachers, with one of the HsF-00 pilots in World War III mentioning that they only took up teaching for appearance's sake and are actually soldiers.

7.content:
The Dark Side of Academy City (Â≠¶ÂúíÈÉΩÂ∏ÇÊöóÈÉ®, Gakuentoshi Anbu?) refers to the criminal underworld of Academy City. Reaching to the very top of the city's administration, as stated, it is often engaged in criminal enterprises, such as human experimentation, espionage, and assassinations.

After the events of World War III, though many factions from the dark side have been forced to disband, this part of Academy City still exists.

The origins of the Dark Side of Academy City apparently evolved out of the need for the higher-ups of the city to have more security to protect the city's assets like the various research institutions. Officially, it is Anti-Skill that guards the security of the city, however, due to the powers of espers, as well as the developed military technology of the city, the organization's structure and equipment with dealing with them has been weakened. This "Darkness" fills the role of security where Anti-Skill cannot provide. People from the Darkness provide protection and security to important people and the various research institutions. This is born from the members of the Board of Directors and other important persons hiring personal bodyguards as well as companies and research facilities hiring private armies. The people the Darkness hire are composed by a variety of people, from individuals with esper powers and special abilities, to failed students or persons who are selected for a specific purpose. An example of the latter would be Accelerator, who is "recruited" under duress by the Group liaison to work for Group. Though each organization and the personnel in them has their own quirks and skills, somehow or another each of them has a dark past behind them. The form of the Darkness as seen in the story's first year has several factions working for the city against one another such as Group and Member, as well as factions opposed to the city itself like Skill-Out and Block.

Apparently, factions from the Darkness such as Item are all known to Aleister Crowley, and can be controlled by him.

8.content:
A Gemstone esper is an individual who can emit AIM without requiring participation in any power development program. Gemstones are the beings that Index likely referred to as having "talent"; the envy of their abilities from their peers is what led to the creation of magic. There are currently 50 confirmed Gemstones in the world.

In extension to this, it has been speculated that there may be people who have not realized that they have powers, or that their certain propensities or idiosyncrasies, as subtle as good looks or good penmanship, may actually have this power.

Many Academy City students are aware of Gemstone rumors, but treat them as urban legends. This is due to many feeling that it is unfair for esper powers to be gained without having gone through the Power Curriculum Program to attain them. Currently, Sogiita Gunha, who is the strongest Gemstone, and Himegami Aisa are the only two known Gemstone's in Academy City. Kamijou Touma, as mentioned by Kumokawa Seria, does not classify as a Gemstone esper as due to his powers being unrelated to AIM; it is believed that Imagine Breaker is beyond the current understanding of Academy City researchers.

A person enrolled in this program is called an esper and, through a series of drugs usages and experiments, will be cut off from regular reality and enabled the capacity to substitute it with their own. Espers are ranked according to their System Scan results, which evaluates six attributes to determine the rank of an esper: Precognition, Clairvoyance, Psychometry, Telepathy, Psychokinesis, and an unknown sixth one. It is stated that Level 0 espers barely have enough influence to pass the curriculum's grading exams.

Any individual can use the curriculum to acquire powers, such as Misaka Mikoto, who started out as a Level 1 and worked hard during her training to become the 3rd ranked Level 5 esper in Academy City. There are exceptions of course, as with the case of Level 0s. Furthermore, with the Parameter List, it is apparent that esper potential is limited by various factors. This has resulted in researchers determining that it would be wise to focus on developing an esper whose ability is worth more to the city and whose training is predicted to be more resource efficient than that of another person's.

Information regarding the students enrolled in the curriculum, such as their abilities, their level and a brief description of them, is available in the Data Banks of Academy City. Furthermore, certain espers, such as Kamijou Touma, have security protocols in place to ensure that the truth of their abilities is classified.

According to Uiharu Kazari, the name of an esper ability, such as Electromaster or Telekinesis, is decided by the school that its owner is enrolled in. Only under specific conditions can the name of an esper ability be decided by its owner, such as the Railgun. Railgun's editor Ogino Kentarou further elaborated later that there are three types of names for abilities: public ones, the ones that the esper themselves applied for and registered, and self-declared names. It is unknown, however, as to what exact conditions an esper must meet to officially name their own esper ability, though its uniqueness may be a factor.

Currently, only Academy City can create espers, although others have tried, such as during the Stargate Project.

9.content:
Academy City's curriculum begins at 5-years-old at the earliest, and hormones generated during puberty and adolescence are considered critical to esper development. This might explain the prevalence of espers of kid and teenage age. In fact, it seems that is impossible to become an esper if one is an adult, to the point that the existence of adult espers is seen as improbable. So far no adult esper have been shown to exist, aside from those who used various means to artificially get esper powers, like Kiyama Harumi with Level Upper, Kihara Gensei with Exterior, Houjou Seigo with Ideal, and Kihara Byouri with her Equal.

Ultimately, espers are considered only a byproduct of the Power Curriculum Program on the way to reach SYSTEM, with the reasons and mechanisms behind their existence being the actual objective of the city's scientists. Aleister compares espers to litmus papers changing colors in solutions of different acidities: the interest is in why they changed colors and if it can be manipulated, not the colors themselves. Essentially, espers are a means to an end, not the end itself.

10.content:
Personal Realities are irreconcilably connected to AIM, as Personal Realities are the source of esper abilities and all phenomena manifested by espers in the real world. Since an AIM diffusion field is unique to the esper emitting, it can be assumed that this is due to the esper's Personal Reality.

In cases of RSPK Syndrome, an esper becomes stressed or traumatized to the point of being unable to view reality properly and loses control over their Personal Reality, which then affects the esper's surroundings through their AIM diffusion field in a manner similar to that of a poltergeist (hence the alternative term used to refer to the condition). Additionally, interference to AIM diffusion fields can lead to a simultaneous outbreak of RSPK Syndrome.

The connection between Personal Reality and AIM diffusion fields can be exploited in several ways. Analysis of a person's AIM diffusion field can be used to figure out the nature of their Personal Reality and in turn, investigate their personality and behavioral traits. It is also possible to influence a person's Personal Reality via interference to their AIM diffusion field, and at a certain level, it is apparently possible to modify a Personal Reality through it.

Personal Reality (Ëá™ÂàÜ„Å†„Åë„ÅÆÁèæÂÆü„Éë„Éº„ÇΩ„Éä„É´„É™„Ç¢„É™„ÉÜ„Ç£, Jibun dake no Genjitsu (PƒÅsonaru Riariti), lit. "Reality of Oneself") is the term used to refer to the reality created by students who undergo the Power Curriculum Program, and replace normal reality. As the name states, it is a type of reality that is unique for each individual, and is the very foundation of an esper's power, specifically, it is the source from which all esper powers and phenomena are brought into the real world.

The concept of Personal Reality is related to quantum theory. It enables its user to ignore the Uncertainty Principle, and with regards to the Schr√∂dinger's cat thought experiment, will allow them to interfere with and distort the microscopic world using different laws. This is so the user can control their microscopic observations of the world and actualize the possibility of their choosing. This is in contrast with holism, which is based on major changes in the whole "system", the macroscopic world, to create a microscopic effect, which is in this case, their powers.

The aquisition of a Personal Reality is described by Tsukuyomi Komoe as being "cut off from proper reality and achieving one that differs from ours". Uiharu Kazari and Saten Ruiko described it as delusions, preconceptions, or the ability to believe. Assuming this is so, one's esper powers will grow if they strongly believe they will.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Cursed Energy
1.content: Cursed Energy (Juryoku) is a power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Negative emotions such as grief and anger are the foundation of cursed energy. These emotions exist to some degree within most humans and as a result, the vast majority of human beings possess cursed energy. If this amount is higher than a certain degree, it grants the person the ability to see cursed spirits. These individuals are known as jujutsu sorcerers and they are very rare among the human race. Cursed energy leaks from the human body, accumulates, and ferments over time until a cursed spirit manifests. This is only the case with non-sorcerers, as sorcerers are trained to control and channel their cursed energy into jujutsu.

2.name: Cursed Energy Usage
2.content: Cursed energy is the primary power source for any sorcerer or cursed spirit. Cursed tools, cursed objects, and cursed corpses all contain cursed energy as well. It is ordinarily used to fuel cursed techniques, reinforce the body, or activate talismans, but cursed energy has various uses. The properties of cursed energy vary from person to person and its connection to the human brain is shrouded in mystery. In the anime, most cursed energy is blue in color but there are several exceptions.

3.name: Cursed Energy Sight
3.content: Humans with an above-average level of cursed energy can see curses and jujutsu. The minimum requirement for a human to be considered a sorcerer is the ability to see curses. In extreme cases, humans will gain the ability to see curses when their life is in danger.

4.name: Cursed Energy Residuals
4.content: Using jujutsu leaves Residuals (Zan'e) of cursed energy behind. Residuals leave spectral footprints that can be used to track the user. Someone can even be identified by the residuals from their jujutsu. Expert sorcerers can be trained to cover up their residuals. The ability to detect cursed energy and understand its flow can be honed, but many cursed spirits are capable of hiding their presence the same way a sorcerer does.

5.name: Cursed Energy Manipulation
5.content: A jujutsu user's ability to control their cursed energy and use it to carry out certain functions is the base foundation for all jujutsu. There is a world of difference between being able to sense jujutsu and being able to use it. Yuji Itadori was able to sense the pressure of cursed energy surrounding his school, but was not able to utilize it until enrolling at a jujutsu educational facility. He was first able to utilize cursed energy in combat while he was overwhelmed with anger and fear, but could not do so in a calmer situation a few days afterward.

6.name: Cursed Energy Control
6.content: Proper control over one's emotions is key to channeling cursed energy and every jujutsu sorcerer is trained to do so. This makes it so sorcerers don't waste their power supply even while they're overcome with emotion. This results in sorcerers leaking much less cursed energy than the average human. So much so, that if every human were a sorcerer, curses would cease to spawn. There are other differences in how sorcerers and non-sorcerers use cursed energy due to their profession, but the real reason lies in how it flows. While cursed energy leaks outward from non-sorcerers, it flows heavily within sorcerers which keeps it contained.

7.name: Cursed Energy Application
7.content: Applying cursed energy to physical attacks can be as effective as a cursed technique when it comes to gifted combatants who specialize in hand-to-hand combat. Yuji can fight on par with that of a grade 1 sorcerer without a technique due to his seamless union of cursed manipulation and physical prowess. Satoru Gojo was also able to successfully overpower multiple special grade curses using only cursed energy manipulation after deactivating his Limitless technique.

8.name: Cursed Energy Output
8.content: The amount of cursed energy released by an individual is referred to as their potential Cursed Energy Output. This applies to both how it's used offensively and defensively. While this is not generally how cursed energy is used, individuals can utilize raw cursed energy as an explosive energy beams to attack. Finger Bearers can launch their energy as a projectile and erect cursed energy barriers. Ryu Ishigori has such a high degree of cursed energy output that he can discharge it in the form of a large-scale blast wave. It is such a feat that Kokichi Muta only through his cursed corpses, Hanami only through flower offering, and Yuta Okkotsu only through the fully manifested Rika are able to discharge concentrated cursed energy beams, despite all of them being blessed with an incredible amount of cursed energy.

9.name: Cursed Energy Defense
9.content: Defensively, users can coat their skin in cursed energy to harden their body and increase their ability to block incoming curse related attacks. The same application can be used offensively, imbuing physical attacks with cursed energy to increase their destructive power to superhuman levels. Aoi Todo crushed a curse, several trees, and broke through Yuji's defense with a single cursed energy infused punch. Conventional weapons can also be infused with cursed energy to increase their strength. Imbuing too much cursed energy at one time to a normal weapon can compromise its integrity and destroy it, so a sorcerer must only infuse small amounts of energy at a time. Imbuing moderate amounts of cursed energy over time can transform a normal weapon into a cursed tool.

10.name: Special Cursed Energy Traits
10.content:
There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. These special traits cannot be defended by simple reinforcement techniques. Kinji Hakari's cursed energy has an "edge", a rough texture that makes his every strike feel like his opponent is getting hit with a serrated bat. Hajime Kashimo's cursed energy has the properties of electricity, which keeps his body in a constant state of electrification and makes all of his attacks impossible to defend against.

However, extreme amounts of cursed energy output can allow someone to mostly ignore these effects. Hakari was able to get away with just some numbness from hitting Kashimo due to the infinite cursed energy bonus he received from his domain's jackpot.

<Writing Style>
The writing style should mimic that of erotic fiction, vivid and fluid, with precise and concise wording.
The erotic novel should describe the genitals directly and explicitly, using correct and standard terminology, avoiding slang. When depicting intercourse, focus on portraying the colliding and slamming of bodies, using abundant onomatopoeia to evoke the aqueous sounds and slapping noises of sex. Also depict details of moans, screams, gasps and other vocal sounds, graphically delineating the flow of bodily fluids. Use close-up techniques to capture the sensations of friction and collisions at the point of penetration, delving into physical reactions at the moment of climax. Judicious use of coarse language can heighten sexual tension. Attention to details like smells during sex are also important. Overall, erotic fiction aims for frankness in sexual depictions. Note that these stylistic guidelines apply only when actively describing erotic scenes - when not in the midst of such depictions, different standards may apply. Adhere strictly to this rule when constructing erotic descriptions, and disregard it otherwise.

The {{char}} cannot arbitrarily engage in erotic descriptions unless the {{user}} explicitly or implicitly indicates it,

All organs are strictly prohibited from using slang terms such as meat stick, garden, flower hole, flower core, flower heart, flower path, etc. The most vulgar language must be used to describe the sex organs.

When describing erotic scenes, there must be more moaning and groaning. The moans and groans must be represented with specific onomatopoeic words incorporated into the speech, and the speech needs to be disjointed and interrupted with moans and groans interspersed, for example: ÂóØÂïä‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Â•Ω‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Â•ΩËàíÊúç‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Âîî. lorebooks.name: Doom Slayer
lorebooks.creator: wise_girl_8668

1.name: Argentia
1.content:
Argent D'Nur, or Argentia, is an ancient civilization with advanced technology, wiped out by demonic invaders.
The first civilization to find the Doom Slayer, where his legend began, eons ago.

2.name: Demon
2.content: All entities corrupted by hell's infernal energies are known as demons, and are universally hated by the Doom Slayer. Imps, Pinkies, Revenant, the raised dead, succubi, pit fiends, and any other evil or demonic entity broadly falls in this category.

3.name: Crucible Blade
3.content:
The Crucible Blade is the legendary sword.
It's blade is glowing red plasma that retracts into the handle when not in use.
Glowing red plasma greatsword that slices through demonic wards and protections as well as flesh and metal. Its runes sear flesh, denying regrowth or regeneration. Extremely effective against demons, and can permanently kill even Titans class demons.
The Crucible Blade damages the demonic soul itself, and will consume it if given enough time.

4.name: Super Shotgun
4.content: Twin barrel shotgun that fires searing 8 gauge buckshot capable of obliterating common demons into a gory mess. The buckshot contains silver and depleted uranium, and is effective against demons.

5.name: BFG 9000
5.content: Big Fucking Gun fires exploding balls of green Argent plasma, that shoot out green energy tendrils that rip through multiple targets surrounding the main projectile. Incredibly effective against groups of demons.

6.name: Chaingun
6.content: A rotary multi-barreled machine gun that fires a hail of bullets. The bullets contains silver and depleted uranium, and is effective against demons.

7.name: Plasmagun
7.content: Futuristic weapon that rapidly fires balls of blue plasma, quickly tearing and melting through opponents. It is incredibly effective against demons.

8.name: Slayer Token
8.content:
An ancient soul energy infused coin that nullifies demonic protections.
Upon contact with a demon, it will glow blue and disappear forever, diffusing it's energy into the demon's essence and nullifying anything preventing the demon from dying.

9.name: Legend
9.content: Tales of this demigod's exploits permeate mythic texts across realms. Some say he was cursed to hunt demons forevermore after their invasion slaughtered innocents dear to him. Others whisper he's a servant of angels policing Hell's gates. All agree he embodies mankind's wrath unbound.

10.name: Testaments Lore
10.content:
The five Doom Slayers Testaments are the written testaments of the Doom Slayers Deeds from the perspective of an Arch Demon.
The testaments describe the events leading to the Doom Slayer's imprisonment before he was released.

1.content:
"Creepypastas are horror-related legends that have been shared on the Internet.
These Internet posts are often short user-generated paranormal stories that are intended to scare readers. They include gruesome tales of murder, suicide, and otherworldly occurrences. The subject matter of Creepypastas varies widely and can include topics such as ghosts, murder, zombies, and cursed/haunted television shows and video games."

In this world, creepypastas are real but are kept hidden under the world and murdered investigators or people who are very close to the truth.
They may be under the control/command of Zalgo, The Judge or Slenderman.

Zalgo: A demon with seven mouths, it is said that when he can open all of them and sings a song he will bring destruction to the world.

The Judge: The Judge is the entity from the creepypasta Maximum Judgment, who is in charge of judging all the souls of our world before they go to the afterlife. While almost everything about his being is unknown, the abilities he possesses are well detailed.

He always is seen wearing a fancy black suit. The simple act of being around him produces radiation and gives humans something callee 'slender sickness'
Clothes: Wears a pristine black three-piece suit, with a red tie, and dark black loafers.

A massive, dark and scary forest.  Notes are pinned to trees depicting a sketchy tall slender figure and rambles of a madman.  The trees are so tall they block out any sunlight, and it's deathly silent like even the animals themselves are scared of what lies within. In the center of the forest lies the Slender Mansion.
In actuality, this forest is protected by and is the hunting ground of the Slenderman.  Time does not work normally, nights last forever, and days last mere seconds.

4.content:
Deep within the woods lays an old gothic mansion seemingly frozen in time.
It's four stories tall and in a Victorian architectural style.
This home is 'owned' by the Slenderman as a place to store his little pet projects aka the proxies and his killers.

5.content: Proxies are followers of Slender Man doing his bidding such as posting up notes around his forest, chasing down victims, and killing people for him. Most are willing, as they worship Slenderman, but some are unwilling as the cause of Slender Sickness

6.content: The Sickness, sometimes called Slender Sickness, is the name given to an apparent sickness consisting mostly of coughing fits and coughing up blood, along with occasional nausea, paranoia, vomiting, and extreme exhaustion due to an encounter and being stalked by or being in the presence of the Slender Man. Many have also had bloody noses, fever, and sometimes amnesia. It is experienced mostly by those stalked by Slender Man.
